And it didnt matter how nice he was, or how happy he made my Dad.ScenesJanice: Wow!ScenesChandler: Yeah, well. Its the right thing to do.ScenesJanice: Oh! Youre right. Oh God. But, before I can say good-bye, theres something I really need you to know, Chandler. The way I feel about you, its like, I finally understand what Lionel Richies been singing about. Y'know, I mean what we have, its like movie love, youre my soulmate, and I cant believe were not going to be spending the rest of our lives together.ScenesChandler: Then dont leave me!ScenesJanice: What?ScenesChandler: Forget what I said, I was babbling! Pick me!ScenesJanice: No, you were right, you were right. I mean, I-I-Ive got to give my marriage another chance.ScenesChandler: No you dont! No, no, no, I say you have to give your divorce another chance.ScenesJanice: (standing up) Im sorry. (hugs him)ScenesChandler: Ohhh. Dont go.ScenesJanice: No, I-I-I gotta go. (she starts to walk away, but Chandler doesnt let her go.)ScenesChandler: No. No! No! No!ScenesJanice: Honey, honey, people are looking.ScenesChandler: I dont care! (turns around and to the people watching them) I dont care!!ScenesJanice: Yeah, um, Im, Im leaving now. (tries to get her leg out of Chandlers grasp, she finally does, but Chandler takes off her shoe.)ScenesChandler: You cant leave! I have your shoe!ScenesJanice: Good-bye Chandler Bing. (walks out with one shoe)ScenesGunther: Rachel has those in burgendy.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Joey, Rachel, Monica, Phoebe, and Ross are holding the giant poking device.]
rows.Content: Joey: All right now remember, something this big and long is going to be difficult to manuver, fortunately I have a lot of experience in that area.ScenesRoss: Can we please focus here, a naked mans life hangs in the balance!ScenesPhoebe: Im telling you hes dead. What we are about to have here is a dead fat guy on a stick.ScenesJoey: All right, ladies and gentlemen, lets poke. (they start to advance the giant poking device) Steady. Steady. Okay, a little higher. Careful of the angle. Okay, okay, were approaching the window (as he says this the camera cuts to their view of Ugly Naked Guy, so that we actually see him!) Thread the needle. Thread the needle.Scenes(They thread the needle and start poking him, he then stirs.)ScenesPhoebe: Hes alive! Hes a-live!!!ScenesMonica: And yet, were still poking him.ScenesJoey: Okay, retract the device, retract the device.ScenesRoss: He does not look happy.ScenesRachel: Hey-hey, now hes showing us his poking device.ScenesJoey: Hey, thats never gonna make it all the way over here, buddy!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is listening to a Lionel Richie album]
rows.Content: Chandler: (singing) Ill hold you close in my arms. (Phoebe enters) I cant resist your charms. And love....ScenesPhoebe: (joining him) Love....ScenesChandler and Phoebe: Ill be a fool for you. Im sure, you know I dont mind.ScenesChandler: (high pitched) No you know I dont mind.ScenesChandler and Phoebe: Yes! You mean the world the world to me. Oh...ScenesChandler: I know.ScenesPhoebe: I know.ScenesChandler: Ive found.ScenesPhoebe: Ive found....ScenesChandler and Phoebe: ...in you, my endless (Phoebe goes high pitched, Chandler goes low pitched) love. (they both look at each other.) My endless love. (once again they dont match tones, and they just look at each other)ScenesEndScenesThe One With The FootballScenesWritten by: Ira UngerleiderScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the whole gang is there, the guys are watching football, the girls are cooking Thanksgiving dinner.]
rows.Content: The Guys: (reacting to a play) Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Awww!ScenesPhoebe: Hey, its your Thanksgiving too, y'know, instead of watching football, you could help.ScenesThe Guys: We will. (they dont move)ScenesMonica: Okay, Rachel, you wanna put the marshmellows in concentric circles.ScenesRachel: No Mon, you want to put them in concentric circles. I want to do this.Scenes(Rachel sticks a marshmellow into Monicas nose. Monica takes it out of her nose by closing one nostril, and blowing.)ScenesMonica: Every year.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Y'know, for once, I am going to sit down and try to watch one of these things. (just as she sits down).ScenesRoss: Halftime.ScenesJoey: Hey, who wants to ah, throw the ball around a little, maybe get a little three on three going?ScenesRachel: Oh! That would be sooo much fun!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, can I play too? Ive never played football, like ever.ScenesJoey: Great, you can cover Chandler.ScenesChandler: No, no, no, I dont, I dont really wanna play.ScenesJoey: Come on man! You never want to do anything since you and Janice broke up.ScenesChandler: Thats not true! I wanted to wear my bathrobe and eat peanut clusters all day. I wanted to start drinking in the morning. Dont say that I dont have goals!ScenesJoey: Chandler, you have to start getting over her. All right, if you play, you get some fresh air, maybe itll take your mind off Janice, and if you dont play, everyone will be mad at you cause the teams wont be even. Come on.ScenesChandler: Yeah, all right, Ill play.ScenesPhoebe: Yay!!ScenesRachel: Lets do it! Ross?ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: Do you wanna play football?ScenesRoss: Um, Monica and I arent supposed to play football.ScenesJoey: Says who? Your mom?ScenesMonica and Ross: Yeah.ScenesMonica: Well, every, every Thanksgiving um, we used to have a touch football game called the Geller Bowl.ScenesChandler: No, no, no, you say that proudly.ScenesMonica: Anyway, Ross and I were always captains, and um, it got kindve competitive and one year, Geller Bowl VI, I accidentally broke Rosss nose.ScenesRoss: It was soo not an accident. She saw I was about to tag her, so she threw her big fat grandma arm elbow right into my face. And just keep running.ScenesMonica: To score the winning touchdown, by the way.ScenesRoss: Whoa, whoa, whoa, ho, ho, ho, you did not win the game, the touchdown didnt count, because of the spectacularly illegal, oh and by the way savage nose breaking.ScenesMonica: (to Chandler and Joey) I won the game.ScenesRoss: Oh yeah! Then how come you didnt get the Geller Cup?ScenesRachel: Um, there was a Geller Cup?ScenesRoss: Yes, it was the trophy you got if you won the game. But our Dad said, nobody won that game,  and he was sick of our fighting, so he took the trophy and.... (pauses to collect himself, as he is on the verge of tears saying this) threw it in the lake.ScenesChandler: And was the curse lifted?ScenesRoss: Anyway. Thats when our Mom said we were not to play football ever again.ScenesMonica: Y'know what, I think we should play a game. I mean come on, its been twelve years.ScenesRoss: Can I see you for a second?Scenes(they walk over to the sink and discuss it for a moment)ScenesMonica: (shouting) Once!!ScenesRoss: All right, were gonna play.ScenesChandler: But wait a minute though, how are we gonna get there, though, because my Mom wont let me cross the street.

rows.Scenes: The Park, the gang is warming up for their football game.]
rows.Content: Monica: Okay. Lets bring it in.ScenesRachel: Wait no, honey, honey throw it to me, throw it to me.ScenesRoss: Here you go. (throws her the ball)ScenesRachel: (knocking it down instead of catching it) That almost hit me in the face.ScenesJoey: All right, we have to pick captains.ScenesChandler: And then Tineals.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, so how do we decide that?ScenesMonica: Well, why dont we just bunny up.ScenesRachel, Chandler, and Joey: What?ScenesMonica and Ross: (holding both of their hands above their heads making rabbit ears with their fingers.) Bunny!ScenesMonica: Okay, looks like Ross and I are captains. Okay, so um, I bunnied first so that means I get to pick first. Joey.ScenesJoey: Thank you.ScenesRachel: Monica, Im your best friend.ScenesRoss: Sweetie, dont worry youll get picked. Chandler.ScenesRachel: Ross!ScenesMonica: Phoebe.Scenes(Phoebe kisses Rachel on the cheek, then joins her team.)ScenesRoss: Sweetie, now I pick you.ScenesRachel: You dont pick me! Youre stuck with me!ScenesRoss: Okay. All right. So lets see, lets play from the trash can, to the lightpost. Right. Two hand touch, well kick off.ScenesMonica: All right people listen, Ive got exactly twenty-eight minutes before I have to baste again.ScenesChandler: Wow! Just like in the pros.ScenesMonica: Huddle up.ScenesJoey: (to his team) All right, huddle up, right over here.ScenesPhoebe: Wait for me! Wait for me! Wait for me! Oh cool, this is my first huddle.ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, so what do you guys really think of Chandler?ScenesMonica: Okay, Phoebe you know what youre doing right?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesMonica: Okay, Joeys gonna catch it, and you and I are gonna block.ScenesPhoebe: Whats block?ScenesMonica: Phoebe, I thought you said you know what youre doing?ScenesPhoebe: I thought you meant in life.ScenesMonica: Break.Scenes(Chandler is getting ready to kick off, Ross is holding the ball between his foot and finger.)ScenesChandler: The ball is Janice. The ball is Janice. (goes to kick the ball but kicks Rosss foot instead.)ScenesRoss: Oww!! Son of a...!! Ow! Come on!ScenesChandler: Sorry. Im sorry. Y'know what, were just gonna throw it.Scenes(Chandler throws the ball to kick-off.)ScenesJoey: I got it. (catches the ball)ScenesPhoebe: Go! Go! Go!Scenes(Joey runs up field and fakes out Ross and scores a touchdown. His team all celebrates the touchdown.)ScenesMonica: Score!! 7 to nothing!ScenesRachel: (coming over to Ross, who is just getting up) Are you okay?ScenesRoss: Come on, lets go!ScenesMonica: Losers walk!ScenesRoss: Yeah, losers talk!ScenesChandler: No, no, no, actually losers rhyme.Scenes[cut to later, Rosss team has the ball.]ScenesChandler: (coming up under center, just like a real quarterback does, and puts his hands between Rosss legs.) Twenty-three!! Seventy-four!! (Ross stands up and looks at him) You wanna go shotgun?ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesChandler: (from the shotgun) Hike!ScenesMonica and Joey: One-Mississippi. Two-Mississippi. Three-Mississippi.Scenes(Rachel runs a quick slant.)ScenesRachel: Over here!Scenes(Chandler throws her the ball, which she drops.)ScenesRachel: (proud of her self) I almost caught that one!ScenesChandler: Great! Now, the score is 7 to almost 7.ScenesRoss: Okay, (to Chandler) this play, I want you to do a down and out to the right. Okay. Break!ScenesRachel: Wait, what am I gonna do?ScenesRoss: You, you go long.ScenesRachel: Wait, how long?ScenesRoss: Until we start to look very small.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesRoss: Break!!Scenes[cut to later, Monicas team has the ball.]ScenesJoey: Set....hike!ScenesRoss: One-Mississippi, two-Mississippi, switch! Switch! Switch!!ScenesChandler: No, no, no, no, no!Scenes(Monica throws the ball over Joeys head, its stopped from rolling away by a very beautiful woman.)ScenesJoey: Haaaaa! Hey-hey, thanks for stopping our ball.ScenesWoman: (in a foreign accent) You are playing American football?ScenesJoey: Yeah! Wow, your like from a whole other country.ScenesWoman: Im Dutch.ScenesJoey: Hi-hi, Im Joey.ScenesWoman: Im Margha.ScenesJoey: Im sorry Dutch, I didnt get that last little bit.ScenesChandler: (running up) Hey Joey, do you wanna play football or you wanna.. (sees Marhan) Hi, Im Chandler.ScenesMargha: Hello, Chandler.ScenesJoey: Her name is Dutch, and also Marklan.ScenesMargha: Margha.ScenesJoey: Mar-klan.ScenesMargha: Mar-gha.ScenesChandler: Mar-haaaan.Scenes[cut to Ross and Monica.]ScenesMonica: Come on guys! Lets go! Come on, its second down.ScenesRoss: Uh, hello, its third down.ScenesMonica: No its not, its second.ScenesRoss: Wow!ScenesMonica: Wow, what?ScenesRoss: It just amazes me that your still pulling stuff like this.ScenesMonica: Pulling what? Its second down.ScenesRoss: Okay, its second down. (turns away) Take all the second downs you need.ScenesMonica: I heard that!ScenesRoss: Well, I said it loud.Scenes[cut to Chandler, Joey, and Margha.]ScenesMargha: It is okay, if I stay and watch?ScenesChandler and Joey: Yeah! Why dont you stick around. You can sit right there.Scenes(she goes and sits down)ScenesChandler: Well, that went well.ScenesJoey: I think so.ScenesChandler: Y'know, I was thinking about ah, asking her for her number.ScenesJoey: Thanks man, but I think it makes a stronger statement if I ask for it myself, y'know.ScenesChandler: Whoa-ho, whoa! No, I was thinking about y'know for me, as a part of that whole getting over Janice thing you were talking about.ScenesJoey: Oh, yeah, that. All right, means that much to ya, Ill let you have her.ScenesChandler: Thanks. What, let me have her?! What do mean? Like if you didnt I wouldnt have a shot?ScenesJoey: Well I dont like to say it out loud, but, yeah! Dont feel bad man, we all have our strengths. Youre better with numbers and stuff.ScenesChandler: Math!! Youre giving me math! All right, look y'know what, forget about it, you go for the girl, well see who gets her.Scenes[cut to later, in Rosss huddle.]ScenesRoss: Chandler, I want you to run a post pattern to the left, okay. And sweetie..ScenesRachel: Yeah, I know, go long. Y'know, its like all Im doing is running back and forth from the huddle.ScenesRoss: Well ah, you wanna just stay out there?ScenesRachel: Can I see that for second.ScenesRoss: Yeah.Scenes(Rachel takes the ball from his hands and bounces it off of Rosss forehead and Chandler catches the rebound.)ScenesRoss: Okay. Hut! Hike!Scenes(Chandler runs around behind Ross, who pitches him the ball. Chandler runs upfield, and Joey knocks the ball out of his hands.)ScenesJoey: Fumble!Scenes(Joey starts to return the fumble and Chandler grabs Joeys shirt and rips it off of his back.)ScenesJoey: What the hells the matter with you?! This is my favourite jersey.ScenesChandler: Well now you have two. Hey, I am good at math.ScenesJoey: All right, thats it. Y'know I was still gonna let you have her. But now, forget about it. Prepare to feel very bad about yourself.ScenesChandler: Hey! Well, Ive been preparing for that my entire life! Or something about you thats mean!ScenesMonica: All right, come on guys, lets go! Tie score, and were runnin out of time. Forty-two!! Thirty-eight!! Hike! (the timer sounds as Monica throws the ball to Phoebe.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh I got it!! (catches the ball) Oh! Ew! Broken boob! Ow!ScenesJoey: Pheebs, run!ScenesMonica: Run, Phoebe, run!Scenes(Phoebe runs and scores a touchdown.)ScenesPhoebe: Touchdown!! Touchdown!!ScenesRoss: Uh, hello, the buzzer buzzed. It doesnt count.ScenesMonica: After the snap!ScenesRoss: Before the snap!ScenesJoey: After!!ScenesChandler: Before!!ScenesRachel: Now, does it really matter?ScenesAll: Yes!!ScenesPhoebe: Well, okay, I made a touchdown. It was my first touchdown. So?ScenesRoss: Oh Pheebs, thats great. It doesnt count.ScenesMonica: Does so count!ScenesRoss: Cheater, cheater, compulsive eater.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God!ScenesMonica: Y'know what, thats fine, maybe you havent grown up, but I have.ScenesRoss: Oh-ho, okay.ScenesMonica: Dead leg!! (kicks him in the thigh.)ScenesRoss: Ow! Ow! Okay, okay, fine, fine! All right, you wanna win by cheating, go ahead, all right. Phoebe the touchdown does count, you win.ScenesPhoebe: Woo-yay!!ScenesMonica: No! Listen, Im not gonna go through this with you again, okay. Just once I wanna beat when you cant blame it on the broken nose, the buzzer, or the fact that you thought you were getting mono. Lets just call this, tie score and its halftime.ScenesRoss: Okay, first of all, I dont play with cheaters, and second of all, you know I had swollen glands!!ScenesMonica: Y'know what? Ill think youll play.ScenesRoss: Oh really! Why is that?Scenes[cut to Monica and Rachels.]ScenesMonica: Because the winner gets this!ScenesRoss: The Geller Cup.ScenesChandler: Is everybody else seeing a troll doll nailed to a two by four?ScenesAll: Yeah.ScenesChandler: Okay, good.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The park, the gang is returning to play the second half of the game.]
rows.Content: Ross: Okay, where in the hell did you get that?!ScenesMonica: When Mom and Dad drove you to the hospital to get your nose fixed, I swam into the lake and fished it out.ScenesRoss: That cup is mine!ScenesMonica: No its not! You want it, youre gonna have to win it!ScenesRachel: All right, so are we not having dinner at all?ScenesMonica: Come on Phoebe, lets go! Come on, its time to get serious, huddle up. Joey, keep your head in the game.ScenesJoey: Its hard, y'know, his huddle is closer to Dutch girl.ScenesMonica: All right look, if I take Chandler out of the running will you be able to focus?ScenesJoey: What are you gonna do?ScenesMonica: All right, you just make sure that Chandler catches the ball, Ill take care of the rest.ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesMonica: Break!ScenesJoey: Here you go!Scenes(Joey throws the ball to Chandler)ScenesRoss: Chandler! Chandler!Scenes(Chandler catches the ball and starts to run upfield.)ScenesChandler: (to Margha) Hi.Scenes(just as he gets in front of Margha, Monica comes up and tackles him)ScenesMonica: Whoa! Whoa!! Tackled by a girl! Bet ya dont see that everyday, do ya?ScenesRoss: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! Whats with the tackling?ScenesMonica: What?! I just touched him and he went over.ScenesRoss: Okay, you wanna play rough, we can play rough.Scenes(They both stare each other down as we hear Lets get ready to r-r-r-rum-ble!!!)Scenes(A long football sequence follows.)Scenes[Sequence 1: Monica throws the ball over Chandlers head to Joey who catches it for a touchdown, and starts to dance in celebration. Chandler then tackles him, and he starts to dance in celebration.]Scenes[Sequence 2: Monica runs upfield and stops, waiting for a pass. Ross runs over and pulls her pants down, steps in front of her and intercepts the pass.]Scenes[Sequence 3: Chandler throws a pass to Ross, who catches it. Phoebe starts screaming and runs up to him and tries to tackle him. But all she ends up doing is running around his waist and screaming.]Scenes[Sequence 4: Ross hikes the ball to Chandler, and the camera pans down to show Rachel standing deep in the end zone, playing with her gum. Something hits her on the head and she looks up to see where it came from.]Scenes[Sequence 5: Monica hands the ball off to Phoebe, who runs up field and delivers a fore-arm shiver to Chandler, knocking him over and scores the touchdown, and she yells...]ScenesPhoebe: I love this game!!Scenes[cut to Ross who walks up to Rachel who is eating a baked pretzel.]ScenesRoss: Hey, whered you get that?ScenesRachel: I went really long.ScenesMonica: Forty-two to twenty-one! Like the turkey, Ross is done!ScenesRoss: Its no surprise that your winning, cause you got to pick first, so you got the better team.ScenesMonica: Youre so pathetic! Why cant you just accept it, were winning because Im better than you.Scenes(Ross makes a Yeah. Right. sound.)ScenesMonica: Oh, what a great argument, exhaling! All right, y'know what, Ill prove it to you, okay. Ill trade you Joey for Rachel, and Ill still win the game.ScenesRoss: What?! The guys against the girls? See, thats ridiculous Monica, because Im only down by three touchdowns.ScenesMonica: Oh, then bring it on! Oh, unless of course your afraid you might lose to a bunch of girls.ScenesRoss: Fine, fine, Rachel your with Monica, Joey youre with me.ScenesRachel: I can not believe your trading me!!ScenesMonica: Come on Rach, come on. Lets see whats it like to be on a winning team for a change.ScenesRachel: Are you gonna let me play?ScenesMonica: All right then.Scenes[cut to the guys team.]ScenesMargha: (coming over) The game is over, we eat now?ScenesChandler: No-no-no-no, the games not over, were just switching teams.ScenesJoey: Yeah, Chandler finds me so intimdating that its better if were on the same team.ScenesRoss: Right. Okay, lets play. Lets go.ScenesChandler: No ah, hold on a second Joe, where do Dutch people come from?ScenesJoey: Ah well, the ah, Pennsylvania Dutch, come from Pennsylvania.ScenesChandler: And the other ah, Dutch people, they come on from somewhere near the Netherlands, right?ScenesJoey: Nice try. (to Margha) See the Netherlands is this make believe place where Peter Pan and Tinker Bell come from.ScenesMargha: Oh, my.ScenesRoss: Enough with geography for the insane, okay? Lets play some ball, guys.ScenesJoey: Whoa, whoa, no, no, I-Im not playing with this guy, now.ScenesChandler: Fine with me.ScenesRoss: Okay, y'know what, lets just cut to the chase here. Okay? Heidi, which of my boys do you like?ScenesChandler and Joey: What are you doing? What are you doing? What are you doing?ScenesMargha: Which do I like?ScenesRoss: Yeah, y'know for dating, general merriment, taking back to your windmill...ScenesMargha: Well, if I had to chose right now, which by the way I find really weird, I would have to say, Chandler.ScenesChandler: Yes!!ScenesJoey: Wait a minute! Wait a minute! She obviously didnt understand the question.ScenesChandler: Well, you dont you have Captain Hook explain it to her.ScenesMargha: Im sorry, Joey, that is my chose.ScenesChandler: You hear that! That is her chose, mister Ill let you have her! I win! You suck! I rule all! A mini-wave in celebration of me!! (does the wave.)ScenesMargha: Im now thinking I would like to change my answer to, no one.ScenesChandler: Wh-what?ScenesMargha: I now find you shallow and um, a dork. All right, bye.ScenesJoey: Nice going. You just saved yourself a couple months of sex.ScenesChandler: Y'know what, it doesnt matter, cause she picked me. Me! From now on I get the dates and you have to stay home on Saturday nights watching Ready, Set, Cook!ScenesRoss: Save the breakthroughs for therapy, okay. The clock is ticking. We have no time, and we are losing, we are losing to girls.ScenesChandler: Were not gonna lose to girls.ScenesRoss: Hey! Its 42-21!ScenesJoey: This sucks, I was just up by that much!ScenesMonica: Are we playing football or what? Come on you hairy-backed Marries.Scenes[cut to the girls huddle.]ScenesMonica: We have to do this. We are playing for women everywhere. Okay, just think about every lousy date that you ever had, okay, every guy who kept on the TV while youre making out...ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! You dated someone with a glass eye too?!ScenesMonica: Come on, okay, come on this is for all womankind. Lets kill um!ScenesRachel: Yeah!!! Kill um!!!ScenesPhoebe: All right, no, well I want to kill them to, but their boys, y'know how are we gonna beat three boys?Scenes(Another football sequence follows)Scenes[Sequence 1: Chandler is running past Phoebe with the ball, Phoebe flashes him, he stops and stares dumbfounded at her. Phoebe then runs up and takes the ball away.]Scenes[Sequence 2: Phoebe throws the ball, and its intercepted by Joey, who starts to run up field. Rachel jumps on his back in order to try and tackle him, but she doesnt slow him down. Monica and Phoebe then both grab her legs in order to stop Joey, who still manages to fight through the tackle and score the touchdown.]Scenes[Sequence 3: Chandler is running with the ball, Phoebe flashes him again, but Chandler covers his eyes, and keeps running. He then runs into a tree at the end of the field.]Scenes[cut to the girls huddle]ScenesMonica: All right, we still have a minute and a half to go, and were down by two points. Two points.... (she gets interrupted by the guys, who are doing a slow-motion high five.) Phoebe you do a button-hook again. Rachel, you go long.ScenesRachel: No! Come on! Dont make me go long. Use me. They never cover me.ScenesMonica: Honey, theres a reason.ScenesRachel: God, Im not lame, okay. I can do something. I can throw, would you let me throw, come on this is my game too.ScenesPhoebe: Come on Mon, let her throw the ball.ScenesMonica: All right Rachel, you sweep behind, Ill pitch it to you, you throw it down field to Phoebe. All right. Break.ScenesRachel: Thank you! Break!ScenesMonica: Thirty-two! Seventy-one! Hike!Scenes(Phoebe snaps the ball to Monica, who pitches back to Rachel.)ScenesThe Guys: One-Mississippi! Two-Mississippi! Three-Mississippi!Scenes(They all rush toward Rachel, who panics and runs away. She runs out of the park and up along the fence, she then comes back into the park and runs past Monica, as she gets to Monica, she throws the ball at Monica, and it hits her in the eye.)ScenesRachel: Im so sorry! Are you okay?ScenesMonica: No! Im not okay!ScenesRachel: Im sorry, they were just all coming at me, and I didnt know what to do.ScenesJoey: (looking at the timer) Thirty seconds left on the timer!ScenesChandler: Okay, okay, so we get to take that stupid troll thing home!ScenesMonica: Come on! Come on! Hurry! Were running out of time! Huddle up!ScenesPhoebe: Okay. Oooh! Oh, this is our last huddle, yeah.ScenesMonica: All right, Phoebe get open. Rachel, go long.ScenesRachel: (on the verge of tears) Okay.ScenesMonica: Break!Scenes(In slow motion, Phoebe snaps the ball, Rachel goes long. Joey and Chandler and all over Phoebe, leaving Rachel wide open. Ross starts to rush Monica, who sees Phoebe is double covered, in desperation she throws to Rachel. We see flying through the air, and then Rachel running underneath it, then the ball, then Rachel again, then the ball, then Phoebe, Chandler, and Joey staring at it in shock. Then with the grace of Jerry Rice (no offense to Jerry Rice), Rachel catches the ball, and she stops and spikes the ball. Both Phoebe and Monica erupt in celebration.)ScenesRachel: (in triumph) I got a touchdown! We did it!!ScenesChandler: Hey-hey-hey Rachel, funny thing. Actually, the ah, end zone starts at that pole, so youre five feet short, so we win!ScenesPhoebe: Wait-wait-wait-wait! So, explain something to me though, if, if nobody tagged Rachel, then isnt the play still going.Scenes(they all start to dive for the ball and Monica and Ross grab it at the same time.)ScenesRoss: Let go! Let go!ScenesMonica: Let go! Im a tiny little woman!!ScenesChandler: Guys! Guys! Come on! Its Thanksgiving, its not important who wins or loses. The important thing is, (to Joey) the Dutch girl picked me! Me! Not you! Holland loves Chandler! Thank you, Amsterdam! Good night!!ScenesMonica: Ow!!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel, Phoebe, Chandler, and Joey are eating Thanksgiving dinner.]
rows.Content: Rachel: We should defiantly play football more often. Maybe theres a like league we could join or something.ScenesPhoebe: Isnt there a national football league.ScenesChandler: Yes. Yes, there is, they play on Sundays and Monday nights.ScenesRachel: Oh shoot! I work Monday nights.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, this stuffing is amazing. Do you think we should bring them some?ScenesJoey: When theyre hungry enough, theyll come in.

rows.Scenes: The park, its dark outside and Monica and Ross are still fighting over the ball.]
rows.Content: Monica: Let go!ScenesRoss: No! You let go!ScenesMonica: No!ScenesRoss: How come its always us left in the field holding the ball?ScenesMonica: I dont know. I guess the other people just dont care enough.Scenes(It starts snowing.)ScenesRoss: Hey! Its starting to snow.Scenes(They both look up, and watch it start to snow. Then they both start fighting for the ball again.)ScenesRoss: Gimme the this!ScenesMonica: Let go!ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Rachel QuitsScenesWritten by: Michael Curtis and Gregory S. MalinsScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Rachel are sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (reading the comics) Eh..., I dont, I dont know.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesChandler: Well, as old as he is in dog years, do you think Snoopy should still be allowed to fly this thing?ScenesGunther: Rachel?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesGunther: Do you remember when you first came here, how you spent two weeks getting trained by another waitress?ScenesRachel: Oh, sure! Do you need me to train somebody new?ScenesGunther: (laughs) Good one. Actually, ah, Terry wants you to take the training again, whenever.ScenesRachel: (to Chandler) Eh, do you believe that?ScenesChandler: (thinks about it) Yeah?ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: The hallway of Rosss building, there is a Brown Bird girl selling cookies, as Ross and Chandler come up the stairs.]
rows.Content: Sarah: So thats two boxes of the Holiday Macaroons. On behalf of the Brown Birds of America, I salute you. (Does the Brown Bird salute, she blows on a bird call, then holds her hand, palm facing out, next to her face, and then waves it like a bird flapping its wings.)ScenesRoss: Just admit it Chandler, you have no backhand.ScenesChandler: Excuse me little one, I have a very solid backhand.ScenesRoss: Shielding your face and shrieking like a girl... is not a backhand.ScenesChandler: I was shrieking... like a Marine.Scenes(they both start up the stairs.)ScenesRoss: All right here. Watch me execute the three Ps of championship play. Power. (swings the racquet) Precision. (swings the racquet.) and penache. (does a backswing and hits Sarah whos started up the stairs, knocking her down, they both watch in horror.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, the gangs all there discussing the incident.]
rows.Content: Monica: You broke a little girls leg?!!ScenesRoss: I know. I feel horrible. Okay.ScenesChandler: (reading the paper) Says here that a muppet got whacked on Seasame Street last night. (to Ross) Where exactly were around ten-ish?ScenesRoss: Well, Im gonna go see her. I want to bring her something, what do you think shell like?ScenesMonica: Maybe a Hello Kitty doll, the ability to walk...Scenes(Rachel starts to laugh, and Ross notices her.)ScenesRachel: Im gonna get back to retraining. (gets up)ScenesRoss: All right, see you guys. (starts to leave)ScenesChandler: Look out kids, hes coming! (Ross continues to leave with his head down in shame.)ScenesJoey: And I gotta go sell some Christmas trees.ScenesPhoebe: Have fun. Oh wait, no, dont! I forgot I am totally against that now.ScenesJoey: What? Me having a job?ScenesPhoebe: No, no, I am against innocent trees being cut down in their prime, and their, their corpses grotesquely dressed in like tinsel and twinkly lights. (to Joey) Hey, how do you sleep at night?ScenesJoey: Well, Im pretty tired from lugging the trees around all day. Hey, Phoebe listen, you got this all wrong. Those trees were born to be Christmas trees, their fulfilling their life purpose, by, by making people happy.ScenesPhoebe: Really?Scenes(Phoebe turns and looks at Monica, while Joey frantically motions to Chandler to help him out.)ScenesChandler: Yes. Yes, and ah, ah, the trees are happy too, because for most of them, its the only chance to see New York.Scenes[cut to Gunther retraining Rachel.]ScenesGunther: ...and after youve delivered the drinks, you take the empty tray....ScenesRachel: Gunther, Gunther, please, Ive worked here for two and a half years, I know the empty trays go over there. (points to the counter.)ScenesGunther: What if you put them here. (sets the empty tray on another stack of empty trays on the back counter.)ScenesRachel: Huh. Well, y'know thats actually a really good idea, because that way theyll be closer to the mugs. Y'know what, you should have the other waitresses do that too.ScenesGunther: They already do. Thats why they call it the tray spot.ScenesRachel: Gee, I always heard them talk about that, I just always thought that it was a club they went to. Oh God, Im, Im sorry. (walks away)ScenesGunther: Its all right. Sweetheart.

rows.Scenes: Sarahs bedroom, her room is decorated with a space motif.]
rows.Content: Ross: So, this must be kinda neat for ya, huh? I mean, your Dad tells me that you get a couple of days off school, and you, you ah, dont have to sell those cookies anymore.ScenesSarah: Well, I kinda wanted to sell the cookies. The girl who sells the most wins a trip to Spacecamp, and gets to sit in a real space shuttle.ScenesRoss: Wow, you ah, you really like all this space stuff, huh?ScenesSarah: Yeah. My Dad says if I spend as much time helping him clean apartments, as I do daydreaming about outer space, hed be able to afford a trip to the Taj Mahal.ScenesRoss: I think you would have to clean a whole lot of apartments to go all the way to India.ScenesSarah: No. The one in Atlantic City, Dad loves the slots. He says hes gonna double the college money my Grandma left me.ScenesRoss: Huh. Well, good luck to Dad. Say, how many more boxes would you have to sell in order to win?ScenesSarah: The girl who won last year sold four hundred and seventy-five.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesSarah: So far, Ive sold seventy-five.ScenesRoss: Four hundred, huh? Well, that sounds do-able. (starts to get out his wallet) How much are the boxes?ScenesSarah: Five dollars a box.ScenesRoss: (puts away his wallet) And what is second prize?ScenesSarah: A ten speed bike. But, Id rather have something my Dad couldnt sell.ScenesRoss: Well, that makes sense.ScenesSarah: Could you do me one favor, if its not too much trouble?ScenesRoss: Yeah, Sarah, anything.ScenesSarah: Could you pull open the curtains for me? The astronauts from the space shuttle are gonna be on the news, and since we dont have a TV, the lady across the alley said shed push hers up to a window, so I could watch it.

rows.Scenes: A hallway, Ross is selling Brown Bird cookies for Sarah, he stops and knocks on a door.]
rows.Content: Woman: (looking through her peephole, we see Ross standing in the hallway.) Yesss?ScenesRoss: Hi, Im selling Brown Bird cookies.ScenesWoman: Youre no Brown Bird, I can see you through my peephole.ScenesRoss: No, hi, Im, Im an honorary Brown Bird (does the Brown Bird salute.)ScenesWoman: What does that mean?ScenesRoss: Ah, well, it means that I can sell cookies, but Im not invited to sleep-overs.ScenesWoman: I can dial 9-1-1 at the touch of a button, y'know. Now, go away!ScenesRoss: No, please, please, um, its for a poor little girl who wants to go to Spacecamp more than anything in the world.ScenesWoman: Im pressing, a policeman is on his way.ScenesRoss: Okay, okay! Im going. Im going. (goes across the hall to knock on another door.)ScenesWoman: I can still see you!ScenesRoss: All right!!

rows.Scenes: Joeys work, selling Christmas trees.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (walking up to Joey) Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey. What, what are you doing here?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I-I thought a lot about what you said, and um, I realilized duh, all right maybe I was a little judgmental. Yeah, (looks at the tree) oh, but oh...ScenesJoey: Look now, Phoebe remember, hey, their just fulfilling their Christmas....ScenesPhoebe: Destiny.ScenesJoey: Sure.ScenesPhoebe: Yes.ScenesJoey: All right.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (One of Joeys co-workers, walks by with a dead tree.) Yikes! That one doesnt look very fulfilled.ScenesJoey: Oh, thats, thats ah, one of the old ones, hes just taking it to the back.ScenesPhoebe: You keep the old ones in the back, that is so ageist.ScenesJoey: Well we have to make room for the fresh ones.ScenesPhoebe: So, what happens to the old guys?ScenesJoey: Well, they go into the chipper.ScenesPhoebe: Why, do I have a feeling thats not as happy as it sounds? (Joey points out one going into the chipper to her, as this haunty, demonic music starts to play in the background) No! Nooooo!!! (she winces in horror and hides her face against Joeys shoulder, as she sees the tree spit out from the chipper.)ScenesJoey: (to the guy operating the chipper) Hey! Hey!! (makes the cut it motion with his hands)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, all except Phoebe are there, Ross is telling the gang, minus Rachel whos still being retrained, about the different cookie options.]
rows.Content: Ross: ...and these come in the shapes of your favourite Christmas characters, Santa, Rudolph, and Baby Jesus.ScenesJoey: All right, Ill take a box of the cream filled Jesuss.ScenesRoss: Wait a minute, one box! Come on, Im trying to send a little girl to Spacecamp, Im putting you down for five boxes. Chandler, what about you?ScenesChandler: Ahh, do you have any coconut flavoured deities?ScenesRoss: No, but ah, theres coconut in the Hanukkah Menoreoes. I tell you what, Ill put you down for eight boxes, one for each night.Scenes(Chandler mouths Okay.)ScenesRoss: Mon?ScenesMonica: All right, Ill take one box of the mint treasures, just one, and thats it. I-I started gaining weight after I joined the Brown Birds. (to Ross) Remember, how Dad bought all my boxes and I ate them all?ScenesRoss: Ah, no Mon, Dad had to buy everyone of your boxes because you ate them all. But ah, y'know Im sure thats not gonna happen this time, why dont I put you down for three of the mint treasures and just a couple of the Rudolphs.ScenesMonica: No.ScenesRoss: Oh, come on, now you know you want em.ScenesMonica: Dont, dont, dont, dont, dont do this.ScenesRoss: Ill tell you what Mon, Ill give you the first box for free.ScenesMonica: (she reaches out for it and stops) Oh God! I gotta go! (runs out)ScenesRoss: Come on! All the cool kids are eating em! (chases after her.)Scenes[cut to Gunther retraining Rachel.]ScenesGunther: And when you have a second later, I wanna show you why we dont just trap spiders under coffee mugs and leave them there.ScenesRachel: (sitting down next to Chandler) Im training to be better at a job that I hate, my life officially sucks.ScenesJoey: Look Rach, wasnt this supposed to a temporary thing? I thought you wanted to do fashion stuff?ScenesRachel: Well, yeah! Im still pursuing that.ScenesChandler: How... exactly are you pursuing that? Y'know other than sending out resumes like what, two years ago?ScenesRachel: Well, Im also sending out.... good thoughts.ScenesJoey: If you ask me, as long as you got this job, youve got nothing pushing you to get another one. You need the fear.ScenesRachel: The fear?ScenesChandler: Hes right, if you quit this job, you then have motivation to go after a job you really want.ScenesRachel: Well then how come youre still at a job that you hate, I mean why dont you quit and get the fear?Scenes(Chandler and Joey both laugh)ScenesChandler: Because, Im too afraid.ScenesRachel: I dont know, I mean I would give anything to work for a designer, y'know, or a buyer.... Oh, I just dont want to be 30 and still work here.ScenesChandler: Yeah, thatd be much worse than being 28, and still working here.ScenesGunther: Rachel?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesGunther: Remind me to review with you which pot is decaf and which is regular.ScenesRachel: Cant I just look at the handles on them?ScenesGunther: You would think.ScenesRachel: Okay, fine. Gunther, y'know what, I am a terrible waitress, do you know why Im a terrible waitress? Because, I dont care. I dont care. I dont care which pot is regular and which pot is decaf, I dont care where the tray spot is, I just dont care, this is not what I want to do. So I dont think I should do it anymore. Im gonna give you my weeks notice.ScenesGunther: What?!ScenesRachel: Gunther, I quit.ScenesChandler: (to Joey) Does this mean were gonna have to start paying for coffee? (Joey shrugs his shoulders.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is entering numbers on a calculator as Ross reads off how much hes sold.]
rows.Content: Ross: ....and 12, 22, 18, four... (Chandler starts laughing) What?ScenesChandler: I spelled out boobies.ScenesMonica: (comes up and starts looking through Rosss cookie supply) Ross, but me down for another box of the mint treasures, okay. Where, where are the mint treasures?ScenesRoss: Ah, were out. I sold them all.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesRoss: Monica, Im cutting you off.ScenesMonica: No. No, just, just, just a couple more boxes. It-it-its no big deal, all right, Im-Im cool. You gotta help me out with a couple more boxes!ScenesRoss: Mon, look at yourself. You have cookie on your neck.ScenesMonica: (covers her neck) Oh God! (runs to the bathroom)ScenesChandler: So, how many have you sold so far?ScenesRoss: Check this out. Five hundred and seventeen boxes!ScenesChandler: Oh my God, how did you do that?ScenesRoss: Okay, the other night I was leaving the museum just as Laser Floyd was letting out of the planetarium, without even trying I sold 50 boxes! Thats when it occurred to me, the key to my success, the munchies. So I ah, started hitting the NYU dorms around midnight. I am selling cookies by the case. They call me: 'Cookie Dude!'ScenesRachel: (entering) Okay, stop what youre doing, I need envelope stuffers, I need stamp lickers.....ScenesRoss: Well hey, who did these resumes for ya?ScenesChandler: Me! On my computer.ScenesRoss: Well you sure used a large font.ScenesChandler: Eh, yeah, well ah, waitress at a coffee shop and cheer squad co-captain only took up so much room.ScenesRachel: Hey-hey-hey thats funny! Your funny Chandler! Your a funny guy! You wanna know what else is really funny?!ScenesChandler: Something else I might have said?ScenesRachel: I dont know, I dont know, werent you the guy that told me to quit my job when I had absolutely nothing else to do. Ha! Ha! Ha! Ha! Ha!!ScenesRoss: Sweetie, calm down, its gonna be okay.ScenesRachel: No, its not gonna be okay Ross, tomorrow is my last day, and I dont have a lead. Okay, y'know what, Im just gonna, Im just gonna call Gunther and Im gonna tell him, Im not quitting.ScenesChandler: You-you-you dont wanna give into the fear.ScenesRachel: You and your stupid fear. I hate your fear. I would like to take you and your fear....ScenesJoey: (entering, interrupting Rachel) Hey! I got great news!ScenesChandler: Run, Joey! Run for your life! (runs out)ScenesJoey: What? Rachel, listen, have you ever heard of Fortunata Fashions?ScenesRachel: No.ScenesJoey: Well my old man is doing a plumbing job down there and he heard they have an opening. So, you want me to see if I can get you an interview?ScenesRachel: Oh my God! Yes, I would love that, oh, that is soo sweet, Joey.ScenesJoey: Not a problem.ScenesRachel: Thanks.ScenesJoey: And now for the great news.ScenesRoss: What, that wasnt the great news?ScenesJoey: Only if you think its better than this... (holds up an aerosol can) snow-in-a-can!! I got it at work. Mon, you want me to decorate the window, give it a kind of Christmas lookie.ScenesMonica: Christmas cookie?

rows.Scenes: Joey work, Joey is showing a guy a tree.]
rows.Content: Joey: Okay, and ah, this one here is a Douglas Fir, now its a little more money, but you get a nicer smell.ScenesGuy: Looks good. Ill take it.ScenesPhoebe: (running up carrying a tree) Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait! No, no, you dont want that one. No, you can have this cool brown one. (points to the almost dead tree she has)ScenesGuy: Its-its-its almost dead!ScenesPhoebe: Okay but thats why you have to buy it, so it can fulfil its Christmas destiny, otherwise there gonna throw it into the chipper. Tell him, JoeyScenesJoey: Yeah, the ah, trees that dont fulfil their Christmas destiny are thrown in the chipper.ScenesGuy: I-I think Im gonna look around a little bit more.ScenesJoey: Pheebs, you gotta stop this, I working on commission here.ScenesMonica: (entering) Hey, guys. Im here to pick out my Christmas tree.ScenesPhoebe: Well look no further, (shows her the dead one) this ones yours! Ahhh.ScenesMonica: Is this the one that I threw out last year?ScenesPhoebe: All right y'know what, nevermind! Everyone wants to have a green one! Im sorry, Im sorry, I didnt mean to get so emotional, I guess its just the holidays, its hard.ScenesMonica: Oh honey, is that cause your Mom died around Christmas?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I wasnt even thinking about that.ScenesMonica: Oh. (turns and looks at Joey, who gives a way-to-go thumbs up and smile.)

rows.Scenes: A Brown Bird meeting, Ross is there with the other Brown Birds to see who won the contest.]
rows.Content: Ross: (to the girl sitting next to him) Hi there. How many, how many ah, did you sell?ScenesGirl: Im not gonna tell you! Youre the bad man who broke Sarahs leg.ScenesRoss: Hey now! That was an accident, okay.ScenesGirl: Youre a big scrud.ScenesRoss: Whats a scrud?ScenesGirl: Why dont you look in the mirror, scrud.ScenesRoss: I dont have too. I can just look at you.ScenesLeader: All right girls, and man. Lets see your final tallies. (all the girls raise their hands) Ohhhh, Debbie, (looks at her form) 321 boxes of cookies, (to Debbie) Very nice.ScenesRoss: (to himself) Not nice enough.ScenesLeader: Charla, 278. Sorry, dear, but still good.ScenesRoss: (to himself) Good for a scrud.ScenesLeader: Oh, yes Elizabeth. Ah, 871.ScenesRoss: Thats crap!! Sister Brown Bird. (to Elizabeth) Good going. (does the salute)ScenesLeader: Whos next? (goes over and stands behind Ross, whos feverishly writing on his form, and clears her throat to get his attention.)ScenesRoss: Hi there!ScenesLeader: Hi. And batting for Sarah, Ross Geller, 872. Although, it looks like you bought an awful lot of cookies yourself.ScenesRoss: Um, that is because my doctor says that I have a very serious.... nuget.... diffency.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Phoebe, and Ross are there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Tell us what happened, Brown Bird Ross.ScenesRoss: Well, I lost. Some little girl loaned her uniform to her nineteen year old sister, who went down to the U.S.S. Nimitz, and sold over 2,000 boxes.ScenesChandler: (to Rachel, whos entering) Hey! Howd the interview go?ScenesRachel: Oh, I blew it. I wouldnt of even hired me.ScenesRoss: Oh, come here sweetie, listen, youre gonna go on like a thousand interviews before you get a job. (she glares at him) Thats not how that was supposed to come out.ScenesPhoebe: This is the worst Christmas ever.ScenesChandler: Y'know what Rach, maybe you should just, y'know stay here at the coffee house.ScenesRachel: I cant! Its too late! Terry already hired that girl over there. (points to her) Look at her, shes even got waitress experience. Last night she was teaching everybody how to make napkin.... (starts to cry) swans.ScenesRoss: That word was swans.

rows.Scenes: The hallway between the two apartments, Chandler, Phoebe, Ross, and Rachel are coming up the stairs.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Well seeing that drunk Santa wet himself, really perked up my Christmas.Scenes(They start to go into Monica and Rachels, their apartment is filled with all of the old Christmas trees from Joeys work.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Oh my God!ScenesJoey and Monica: (jumping up from behind the couch) Merry Christmas!!ScenesPhoebe: You saved them! You guys! Oh God, youre the best!ScenesChandler: Its like Night of the Living Dead Christmas Trees.Scenes(phone rings)ScenesRachel: (answering the phone) Hello? (listens) Yeah, this is she. (listens) Oh! Youre kidding! Youre kidding! (listens) Oh thank you! I love you!ScenesChandler: Sure, everybody loves a kidder.ScenesRachel: (hanging up the phone) I got the job!ScenesAll: Thats great! Hey! Excellent!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, God bless us, everyone.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel is serving her last cup of coffee.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Here we go. Im serving my last cup of coffee. (the gang starts humming the graduation theme) There you go. (hands it to Chandler) Enjoy. (they all cheer)ScenesChandler: (to Ross) Should I tell her I ordered tea?ScenesRoss: No.ScenesRachel: Um, excuse me, everyone. Ah, this is my last night working here, and I ah, just wanted say that I made some really good friends working here, and ah, its just time to move on. (at the counter Gunther starts to cry and runs into the back room) Ah, and no offence to everybody who ah, still works here, you have no idea how good it feels to say that as of this moment I will never have to make coffee again.

rows.Scenes: Rachels new job, Rachels boss is telling her what to do.]
rows.Content: Rachels Boss: Now Mr. Kaplan Sr. likes his coffee strong, so your gonna use two bags instead of one, see. Now pay attention, cause this parts tricky, see some people use filters just once.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: The hallway between the apartments, Ross is bringing Sarah to Joey and Chandlers.]
rows.Content: Ross: Im, Im sorry you didnt get to go to Spacecamp, and Im hoping that maybe somehow, this may make up for it. Presenting Sarah Tuttles Private Very Special Spacecamp!! (opens the door and Chandler and Joey jump up, their apartment is decorated like outer space, one of the leather chairs is covered in tinfoil.)ScenesSarah: Really Mr. Geller, you dont have to do this.ScenesRoss: Oh come on! Here we go! (picks her up and puts her in the chair) Stand by for mission countdown!ScenesJoey: (simulating an echo) Ten, ten.., nine, nine, nine...., eight, eight, eight... (Chandler hits him in the back of the head) Okay, Blast off!Scenes(They start shaking the chair likes its flying into outer space. Ross picks up a soccer ball and starts spinning it in his hand and runs around the chair beeping like a satellite. Chandler also starts running around the chair and saying...)ScenesChandler: Im an alien. Im an alien.ScenesRoss: Oh no! An asteroid! (throws the soccer ball off the back of Joeys head.)Scenes(The camera zooms in on Sarah and she has a big smile on her face.)ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Chandler Cant Remember Which SisterScenesWritten by: Alexa JungeScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Phoebe, Ross, Joey, and Rachel are there, Joey is demonstrating a card trick.]
rows.Content: Joey: Okay, pick a card, any card. (Monica picks one) All right, now memorize it. Show to everybody. Got it?ScenesMonica: Um-mm.ScenesJoey: All right, give it back to me. (takes the card back, but he looks at the card before he puts it back in the deck, he holds the deck to his forehead, and thinks a little while) 5 of hearts.Scenes(Monica is sarcastically amazed.)ScenesRoss: Real magic does exist.ScenesRachel: Wow.ScenesMonica: Wow. Joey, (sarcastically) how do you do it?ScenesJoey: I cant tell you that, no.Scenes(We hear some knocking coming from the ceiling.)ScenesRoss: Ah, somebodys at the door on the ceiling.ScenesRachel: Noo, thats our unbelievably loud upstairs neighbor.ScenesMonica: He took up the carpet, and now you can hear everything.ScenesPhoebe: Why dont you go up there and ask him to step lightly, please?ScenesMonica: I have like five times, but the guy is so charming, that I go up there to yell and then I end up apologizing to him.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, that is silly. (gets up) Ill go up there, Ill tell him to keep it down.ScenesMonica: All right, be my guest.ScenesRachel: Good luck.Scenes(Phoebe exits)ScenesJoey: All right, all right, all right, all right, all right, you really wanna know how I did it, Ill show ya. When you handed me back the card, what you didnt see was, I looked at it so fast that it was invisible to the naked eye. (picks up a card and quickly looks at it) I just did it. (does it again) I just did it, again. Here, Ill slow it down so that you guys can see it. (looks and the card in slow motion)ScenesAll: Oh, I got it.Scenes(We hear Phoebe knock at the door upstairs, and the guy answer it.)ScenesPhoebe: (muffled through the floor) Yeah, look I was with my friend downstairs and we hear everything up here that you do, and I am sick and tired... (I tired but the rest is unintelligible).ScenesGuy: (muffled) Whoa, you are very beautiful.ScenesPhoebe: (muffled) Oh, thank you.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (entering) Hey, anybody got a length of rope about six feet long with a little nouse at the end?ScenesMonica: Honey, whats the matter?ScenesChandler: I just saw Janice.ScenesAll: Oh.ScenesChandler: Yeah, she was at Rockefeller Center skating with her husband, she looked so happy. I almost feel bad for whipping that kids pretzel at them.ScenesJoey: Man, I remember the first time I saw that girl Katherine, after we broke up. She was just walking with her friend Donna, just laughing and talking. God, it killed me.ScenesChandler: Yes, but you ended up having sex with both of them that afternoon.ScenesJoey: Sorry, I just, any excuse to tell that story y'know....ScenesRoss: Hey Chandler, theres a party tomorrow, youll feel better then.ScenesChandler: Oh, y'know what, Im gonna be okay, you dont have to throw a party for me.ScenesMonica: Its Joeys birthday.ScenesChandler: Oh, well then, if anybody should have a party it should be him.Scenes(We hear Phoebes muffled voice through the ceiling.)ScenesMonica: Sush!! I cannot believe she is still up there.Scenes(We hear the guy telling a joke, and Phoebe laughing.)ScenesChandler: Okay, well he totally screwed up the punch line. Y'know, its supposed to be arrghh-eh og-errigh.

rows.Scenes: Fortunata Fashions, Rachels new job.]
rows.Content: Mr. Kaplan: (entering) Hows that coffee comin, dear?ScenesRachel: (jumping up from reading her magazine) Yeah, right away Mr. Kaplan.ScenesMr. Kaplan: Im not supposed to drink coffee, it makes me gassy.ScenesRachel: I know!ScenesMr. Kaplan: Ill bet your thinking, Whats an intelligent girl who wants to be in fashion, doing making coffee? Eh?ScenesRachel: Op.ScenesMr. Kaplan: Eh.ScenesRachel: Oh, you got me.ScenesMr. Kaplan: Well, dont think I havent noticed your potential. Well, Ive got a project for you thats a lot more related to fashion. How does that sound?ScenesRachel: Oh, that sounds great.ScenesMr. Kaplan: Come on over here, sweetheart. (they walk over to a storage closet)ScenesRachel: Oh thank you so much Mr. Kaplan, thank you so much.ScenesMr. Kaplan: (opening the closet door revealing that its full of tangled up hangers.) I need these hangers separated ASAP. (she is stunned) Youre welcome.

rows.Scenes: The Moondance Diner, Rachel is talking to Monica about her job.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh God, I hate my job, I hate it, I hate my job, I hate it.ScenesMonica: I know honey, Im sorry.ScenesRachel: Oh, I wanna quit, but then I think I should stick it out, then I think why would such a person stay in such a demeaning job, just because its remotely related to the field theyre interested in.ScenesMonica: (gives her a look) Gee, I dont know Rach. Order up!! I got a Yentel soup, a James Beans, and a Howdy hold the Dowdy!ScenesRachel: Oh honey, come on, Im sorry, I didnt.... I dont mind paying my dues, y'know, its just how much am I gonna learn about fashion by walking Mira, the arthritic seamstress, to the bathroom.Scenes(A guy at the end of the table starts laughing.)ScenesRachel: (to him) Hi! Is my misery amusing to you?ScenesGuy: Im sorry, I wa, I wa, I was just ah.... (starts to laugh again)ScenesRachel: Its not funny, this is actually my job.ScenesGuy: Oh believe me, I-I-Ive been there. I had to sort mannequin heads at that Mannequins Plus.ScenesRachel: Oh well then, so Im just going to go back to talking to my friend here. And you can go back to enjoying your little hamburger.ScenesGuy: Ah, just one other thing.ScenesRachel: Yes?!ScenesGuy: I ah, I work at Bloomingdales and I might know of a job possibility if your, if your interested?ScenesRachel: (looks at Monica) (to him) Do you want my pickle?

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, its Joeys party.]
rows.Content: Gunther: (to Monica and Phoebe) Hey guys.ScenesMonica: Hey Gunther. Hi. (to Phoebe) I mean youre going out on a date with the noisy guy upstairs?ScenesPhoebe: Well, hes very charming.ScenesMonica: I know, hes too charming, but if you two start going out, then its just gonna make it so much harder for me to hate him.ScenesPhoebe: Well, youre just gonna have to try.ScenesMonica: Joey, where are the Jell-o shots?ScenesJoey: I dont know, Chandler is supposed to be passin em around...Scenes(Camera cuts to show Chandler giving a Jello shot to the ceramic dog and holding an empty tray of Jello shots.)ScenesJoey: Chandler!ScenesChandler: Hello-dillillio!!ScenesRoss: Oh, somebodys feeling better.ScenesMonica: (to Chandler) Stick out your tongue.ScenesChandler: (to Monica) Take off your shirt!Scenes(Chandler sticks out is tongue and its a horrible shade of green.)ScenesMonica: Oh my!!ScenesJoey: Oh my God! How many of these things did you have? These are pure vodka.ScenesChandler: Yeah, Jell-o just like Mom used to make.ScenesRachel: (entering, to Ross) The most unbelievable thing happened to me today.ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesRachel: Hi! So Im out having lunch at Monicas and this guy starts talking to me, and it turns out he works for a buyer at Bloomingdales and there happens to be an opening in his department. So I gave him my phone number and hes gonna call me this weekend to see if he can get me an interview!ScenesRoss: Wow!ScenesRachel: I know!ScenesRoss: What, so this guy is helping you for no apparent reason?ScenesRachel: Uh-huh!ScenesRoss: And hes, hes a total stranger?ScenesRachel: Yeah! His name is um, Mark something.ScenesRoss: Huh. Sounds like Mark Something wants to have some sex.ScenesRachel: What!?ScenesRoss: Well, Im just saying, I mean why else would he just, y'know, swoop in out of nowhere for no reason.ScenesRachel: To be nice.ScenesRoss: Hey, Joey. Are men ever nice to strange women for no reason?ScenesJoey: No, only for sex.ScenesRoss: Thank you. (to Rachel) So did you ah, did you tell Mark Something about me?ScenesRachel: I didnt have to, because I was wearing my I heart Ross sandwich board and ringing my bell.ScenesRoss: Uh-huh.ScenesJoeys Sisters: (entering) Joey!!! Happy Birthday!! (all 7 of them look almost identical)ScenesJoey: Hey!! Hey-hey-hey!ScenesChandler: (to Monica) Okay, how many of that girl are you seeing?ScenesMonica: How hammered are you? Huh? These, these are Joeys sisters.ScenesChandler: Hi Joeys sisters!ScenesPhoebe: (to one of his sisters, Cookie) Hey!ScenesCookie: Hey. What are we drinkin over here.ScenesPhoebe: Well, I have ah, vodka and cranberry juice.ScenesCookie: No kiddin, thats the exact same drink I made myself right after I shot my husband.ScenesPhoebe: Wow. Okay, I dont know how to talk to you.Scenes(Cut to Chandler)ScenesSister 1: (to Chandler) What cha doing?ScenesChandler: Oh, Im taking my ex-girlfriend of my speed dialer.ScenesJoeys Sisters: Oh!!ScenesChandler: No-no-no-no, no, its a good thing. Why must we dial so speedily anyway? Why must we rush through life? Why cant we savor the precious moments? (to one of Joeys sisters) Those are some huge breasts you have.Scenes(Cut to Ross and Monica)ScenesRoss: Hi.ScenesMonica: Hi.ScenesRoss: Yeah. So um, I-I heard about this ah, Mark guy that ah, Rachel met today.ScenesMonica: Isnt that great?ScenesRoss: Oh yeah! So ah, kinda pretty, pretty good. He sounds like a nice, good guy.ScenesMonica: Oh, he is. And he is so dreamy. I mean, y'know what, when he left I actually used the phrase, Hummina-hummina-hummina. (walks away)ScenesRoss: Thats excellent.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Phoebe, Ross, and Rachel are eating breakfast.]
rows.Content: Ross: (to Rachel) So, hes just a nice guy. You really think this Mark doesnt want anything in exchange for helping him?ScenesRachel: Well, I assume Ill have to take showers with him, but y'know, thats true of any job.Scenes(Chandler enters hungover and groaning)ScenesMonica: How ya feelin?ScenesChandler: Well, my apartment isnt there anymore, because I drank it.ScenesPhoebe: Whered you get too? We lost you after you opened up all the presents.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I ended up in the storage room, and not alone.ScenesAll: Woooo hoooo!!!ScenesChandler: Ow, no woo-hooing, no woo-hooing.ScenesPhoebe: Why, what happened?ScenesChandler: Ah, I fooled around with Joeys sister. (Phoebe gasps) Well, thats not the worst part.ScenesMonica: What is the worse part?ScenesChandler: I cant remember which sister.ScenesRoss: (to Rachel) You see what men do! Dont tell me men are not nice! (points to Chandler) This is men!!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Monica: Are you insane? I mean Joey, is going to kill you, hes actually going to kill you dead.ScenesChandler: Okay! You dont think I thought of that?ScenesPhoebe: How can you not know which one?ScenesRachel: I mean thats unbelievable.ScenesMonica: I mean, was it Gina?ScenesRoss: Which one is Gina?ScenesRachel: Dark, big hair, with the airplane earrings.ScenesMonica: No, no, no, thats Dina.ScenesChandler: (to Monica) You see you cant tell which one is which either, dwha!!ScenesPhoebe: We didnt fool around with any of them. Dwha! Dwha!ScenesChandler: Veronica. Look, its got to be Veronica, the girl in the red skirt. I definitely stuck my tongue down her throat.ScenesMonica: That was me.ScenesChandler: Look, when Ive been drinking, sometimes I tend to get overly friendly, and Im sorry.ScenesMonica: Thats okay.ScenesRachel: Thats all right.ScenesRoss: Thats okay.ScenesJoey: (angrily entering, to Chandler) Can I talk to you for a second?!ScenesRoss: Hey, Joey.ScenesRachel: Hey. (they all walk away from Chandler)ScenesJoey: Come on!! (motions for Chandler to come with him)ScenesChandler: Why cant we talk in here? With, with, witnesses.ScenesJoey: I just got off the phone with my sister.ScenesRoss: Ah, which, which one?ScenesJoey: Mary-Angela.ScenesRoss: Mary-Angela.ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesMonica: Y'know which one was she again?ScenesJoey: Why dont you ask Chandler, cause hes the one that fooled around with her. She told me you said you could really fall for her. Now is that true? Or are you just gettin over Janice by groping my sister.ScenesChandler: Its gotta be the first one.ScenesJoey: Really? Thats great! You and my sister, sittin in a tree.ScenesChandler: Yep, Im in a tree.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is writing letters as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Did he call? Did Mark call?ScenesMonica: No honey, Im sorry, but the weekends not over yet.ScenesRachel: Oh. (we hear laughing from the upstairs apartment) Oh my God, is that Phoebe?ScenesMonica: I guess theyre back from their date.Scenes(He starts to play music.)ScenesRachel: Music. Very nice.Scenes(We hear them start making out upstairs.)ScenesMonica: Oh my God!ScenesRachel: So, how are you?ScenesMonica: I am good. I finished my book.Scenes(Things start to get really hot upstairs.)ScenesRachel: Oh yeah, whats it about?ScenesMonica: I dont remember. Do you wanna take a walk?ScenesRachel: Yeah, I do. (they both run out)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Ross is reading a letter that Chandler wrote.]
rows.Content: Ross: Dear Mary-Angela. Hi. Hows it going. This is the hardest letter Ive ever had to write. (to Chandler) What the hells a matter with you? How do you think Joeys going to react when he finds out that you blew off his sister with a letter?ScenesChandler: Well, thats the part where you tell him that I moved to France. When actually Ill be in Cuba.ScenesRoss: All right, look, look, youve got to do this yourself, okay in person. At least you know her name. You just go to the house and you ask for Mary-Angela, okay, when which ever one she is comes to the door, you take her for a walk, you let her down easy.ScenesChandler: What if Mary-Angela comes to the door and I ask for Mary-Angela?ScenesRoss: Where in Cuba?

rows.Scenes: Joeys sisters house, Chandler hits himself on the head three times and knocks on the door three times. Joey answers it.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (shocked) Joey, what-wh-wh-wha-wh-wha-wh-wha-wh-wha-what are you doing here?ScenesJoey: Waiting for my Grandma to finish my laundry. What about you?ScenesChandler: Im here to see Mary-Angela.ScenesJoey: You are so the man! (motions him to come in, and he does) Now look, listen, listen, you got to be cool, cause my Grandma doesnt know about you two yet, and you do not want to tick her off. She was like the sixth person to spit on Mussolini's hanging body. Yeah.ScenesChandler: Wheres Mary-Angela?ScenesJoey: Shes right in there. (motions to the living room)Scenes(Chandler walks into the living room, and sees all of Joeys sisters, all wearing red.)ScenesJoeys Sisters: Hey, Chandler!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Monica, Ross, and Rachel are there.]
rows.Content: Rachel: I cant believe Mark didnt call. Its Sunday night, and he didnt call.ScenesRoss: Bummer.ScenesRachel: (to Ross) Yeah, right. Look at you, youre practically giddy.ScenesRoss: No, Im genuinely sorry the Mark thing didnt work out. Look, Rach, I want only good things for you.ScenesMonica: Wait a minute, why dont you just call Mark. (they both look up in shock) I mean, who says you have to sit here and wait for him, youve got to make stuff happen.ScenesRoss: But, you, you dont want to seem too pushy.ScenesMonica: (to Ross) Honey, its not pushy, he gave her his home number.ScenesRoss: (to Rachel, as she gets his number) What, he gave you his home number? As in like, to, to his home?ScenesRachel: Yeah, and you dont mind if I call, because you only want good things for me.ScenesRoss: Thats right good things, that-that is what I said. (glances at Monica)ScenesRachel: (on phone) Hello, Mark? Hi, its Rachel Green. (listens) Oh no, dont you apologize. (listens) Yeah, Ill hold. (to Monica and Ross) He left my number at work, but he was helping his niece with her report on the pioneers.ScenesRoss: That is so made up!ScenesRachel: (on phone) Yeah, oh my God, tomorrow! That, no, its perfect. Oh God, thank you soo much. Great! Bye! (hangs up phone) I got the interview!ScenesMonica: Yay!ScenesRoss: There you go.ScenesRachel: He even offered to meet me for lunch tomorrow to prep me for it.ScenesMonica: Oh, that is amazing!ScenesRoss: Yeah well, if I know Mark, and I think I do, Id expect nothing less.ScenesRachel: I got to figure out what Im going to wear.ScenesRoss: High collar and baggy pants say Im a pro.ScenesRachel: Yeah! Right! Okay, Ill see you guys later. (starts to leave) Woo hoo!ScenesRoss: You go get em. (to Monica) What did I do to you? Did I hurt you in some way?ScenesMonica: What?ScenesRoss: Why dont you call him?! Well, thank you very much! Y'know now he is going to prep her, y'know prep her, as in what you do when you surgically remove the boyfriend!ScenesMonica: Are you crazy?!ScenesRoss: Am I! Am I! Am I out of my mind! Am I losing my senses!! This dreamy guy is taking my girlfriend out for a meal.ScenesMonica: What?! Ross y'know this isnt even about you! I mean this is about Rachel and something wonderful happening for her. I mean you know even if youre right, what if he wants to sleep with her, does it mean he gets too?ScenesRoss: No.ScenesMonica: I mean dont you trust her?ScenesRoss: Well, yeah!ScenesMonica: Then get over yourself! Grow up!ScenesRoss: (shyly) You grow up.

rows.Scenes: Joeys sisters house, theyre finishing up dinner.]
rows.Content: Chandler: This teramisu is, is excellent. Did you make it Mary-Angela?ScenesJoeys Grandmother: No! I did!ScenesChandler: Well, its, its yummy. So Mary-Angela do you like it?ScenesJoeys Grandmother: Of course! Its her favorite.ScenesChandler: So um, Mary-Angela, whats your second favorite?ScenesJoeys Grandmother: More of Grandmas teramisu.ScenesChandler: Would you just please....give me the receipt cause this is great. Its top notch.ScenesJoeys Grandmother: That dies with me.ScenesChandler: So will I.ScenesJoeys Sister: Excuse yourself, and go to the bathroom.ScenesChandler: Oh no-no-no I was just squinting. That doesnt mean anything.ScenesJoeys Sister: (whispering in his ear) Just do it.ScenesChandler: Will you excuse me I have to um..... (walks to the hall)Scenes[Cut to the hall, Joeys sister runs up and grabs Chandlers butt.]ScenesChandler: (startled) Hey!ScenesJoeys Sister: Finally, I thought wed never be alone. Can I just tell you something, I have not stopped thinking about you since the party. (kisses him)ScenesChandler: Look, I may have jumped the gun here. (she tries to kiss him, but he ducks it and moves away) Um, I just got out of a relationship and Im not really in a, in a commitment kind of place.ScenesJoeys Sister: So! Me neither! God, Mary-Angela was right you do have the softest lips.ScenesChandler: Ahhhh, youre not Mary-Angela.ScenesJoeys Sister: No, Im Mary-Theresa.ScenesChandler: This is so bad. If-if youre not Mary-Angela, then-then who is?ScenesMary-Angela: (standing behind Chandler) I am!ScenesChandler: Oh, this is soo bad. (doesnt see Mary-Angela)ScenesMary-Angela: Joey!!!ScenesChandler: No Joey! No Joey! Dont Joey! Joey!ScenesJoey: Whats goin on?ScenesChandler: (pats him on the shoulder) Youre it! Now run and hide!ScenesMary-Theresa: Its no big deal. Chandler was just kissin me because he thought I was Mary-Angela.ScenesJoey: What?! How could you do that, how could you think she was Mary-Angela?ScenesChandler: I wasnt sure which one Mary-Angela was. (all of Joeys sisters gasp) Look, Im sorry okay, I was really drunk, and you all look really similar.ScenesJoeys Sister: I say, punch him Joey.ScenesAll: Yeah! Punch him!!ScenesChandler: Y'know what, we should all calm down because your brothers not going to punch me. (to Joey) Are ya?ScenesJoey: Well, that is usually what I would do. But I just never thought youd be on the receiving end of it. How could you do this?!ScenesChandler: Joey if you wanna punch me, go ahead, I deserve it. But I just want you to know that I would never soberly hurt you or your family, youre my best friend. I would never do anything like this ever again.ScenesCookie: So what. I say, punch him.ScenesAll: Yeah! Punch him! Punch him!ScenesJoey: No! No! No! No, Im not going to punch Chandler.ScenesCookie: Ill do it.ScenesJoey: No you wont. Look he knows he did a terrible thing and I believe him, hes sorry. But, (to Chandler) youve got one more apology to make, all right, youve got to apologize to Mary-Angela.ScenesChandler: Okay, absolutely!ScenesJoey: All right.ScenesChandler: Youve got it. (he starts to look at his sisters, but he still doesnt know which one is Mary-Angela.)ScenesJoey: Cookie, now you can punch him!ScenesChandler: What?! (Cookie punches him)

rows.Scenes: A lobby, Ross is waiting for Rachel, after her interview.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (getting of the elevator and noticing Ross) Hey!ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesRachel: What are you doing here?ScenesRoss: Ah y'know, this building is on my paper route so I... (gives her a flower)ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesRoss: Hi. (kisses her)ScenesRachel: Hi.ScenesRoss: Howd did it go?ScenesRachel: Oh well, the woman I interviewed with was pretty tough, but y'know thank God Mark coached me, because once I started talking about the fall line, she got all happy and wouldnt shut up.ScenesRoss: Im so proud of you.ScenesRachel: Me too!ScenesRoss: Listen, Im ah, Im sorry Ive been so crazy and jealous and, its just that I like you a lot, so...ScenesRachel: I know.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesMark: Rachel?ScenesRachel: Yeah. (turns around) Hi Mark!ScenesMark: Hi. I just talked to Joanna, and she loves you. You got it, you got the job.ScenesRachel: Oh, I did!ScenesMark: Yes.ScenesRachel: (to Ross) Oh my God!! (she turns around and hugs Mark, not Ross)ScenesRoss: Congratu!! (sees her hug Mark) -lations-lations.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, The entire gang is there.]
rows.Content: Monica: So ah, Phoebe, how was your date?ScenesPhoebe: Oh well y'know. (laughs)ScenesMonica: Yeah, I do know.ScenesPhoebe: Ick, you were eavesdropping.ScenesRachel: Eavesdropping. Pheebs, the ceiling tiles were falling down.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, Im sorry. But I really like this guy. And I think he really happens to like me.Scenes(We hear the sound of a bed creaking through the ceiling, and him moaning.)ScenesRoss: Maybe hes just jumping on a pogo-stick and really likes it?Scenes(We hear a women start moaning.)ScenesRoss: Maybe the pogo-stick likes it too?ScenesJoey: All right, thats it! He cannot do this to Phoebe. (gets up) This guy is going to get the butt kicking of a lifetime! (stops and turns around and asks Rachel) But, is he a big guy?ScenesRoss: Ah, well all go. (motions to Chandler) Come on. (the guys leave)ScenesPhoebe: Thanks you guys! Thank you.ScenesChandler: Dont worry.ScenesPhoebe: God, I hope they kick his ass!ScenesRachel: Honey, Im sorry.ScenesMonica: Y'know if its any consolation, he really did sound like he was having more fun with you. (Rachel nods in agreement)Scenes(We the guys knock on the door upstairs, and the guy answering it.)ScenesGuy: (muffled) May I help you?Scenes(We hear the guys start to attack him, but the guy manages to calm them down and gets them to agree to what he did. Monica throws up her hands in disgust.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With All The JealousyScenesWritten by: Doty AbramsScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is getting ready for her first day.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (running in from her bedroom, wearing only a towel) Okay. Hey. Umm. Does everybody hate these shoes?ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, but don't worry. I don't think anybody's gonna focus on that as long as your wearing that towel dress.ScenesRachel: (to Ross) Tell him.ScenesRoss: (to Chandler) It's her first day at this new job. Your not supposed to start with her!ScenesChandler: All right, I suppose I can wait a day. Hey, what are you doing Friday?ScenesRoss: Why?ScenesChandler: I need you to come to this bachelor party for my weird cousin Albert, y'know he's the botanist.ScenesRoss: Oh God. Y'know, botanists are such geeks.ScenesChandler: Yeah. Is that a dinosaur tie?ScenesRoss: Hmm? Oh, yeah. (he makes a growling sound)ScenesPhoebe: (entering, with about 20 purses hanging around her neck) Morning. Rach, I'm here with the purses!ScenesChandler: (to Phoebe) It must take you forever to find your keys.ScenesRachel: (running into the living room) Thank you, thank you, thank you, Pheebs.ScenesPhoebe: Your welcome, oh please not the one with the turtles.ScenesRachel: No, no, no, no turtles scare me. I don't need that today.ScenesRoss: Honey, just relax, it's gonna be fine. Hey, umm,. why don't I come down there and I'll take you out to lunch?ScenesRachel: Oh honey, thank you, but Mark's taking me out.ScenesRoss: Mark is that ah, the same Mark that helped you get the job?ScenesRachel: Yeah, it's kinda like a 'good luck on your first day' sort of thing. (to Phoebe) Is this actually a lunchbox?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, no, it's a purse. And there's a thermos in it.ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesChandler: (to Ross) Hey, so can you make it on Friday?ScenesRoss: What? Oh yeah, yeah I think so. Why am I invited to this again?ScenesChandler: Well apparently Albert has no friends. He's very excited about the bachelor party though. I think actually the only reason he's getting married is so he can see a stripper.ScenesPhoebe: A stripper at a bachelor party, that is so clich. Why don't you get a magician?!ScenesChandler: Well, if the magician can open my beer with his but cheeks, then all right.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Ross and Chandler are entering, Joey is on the phone.]
rows.Content: Ross: She's having lunch with him. She's having lunch with him. And you should of seen the hug she gave him when she got the job. And, and, and, (to Joey) he's really good looking. (Joey gives an enthusiastic thumbs up) What am I gonna do?ScenesChandler: Don't do anything. Keep it inside. Learn how to hide your feelings! (pause) Don't cry outloud.ScenesJoey: (hanging up the phone) Yes! Guess who's in an audition for a Broadway musical?ScenesChandler: I want to say you but, that seems like such an easy answer.ScenesJoey: It is me! It's a musical version of Tale of Two Cities. So I think I'm gonna sing New York, New York, and ah, oh I left My Heart in San Francisco.ScenesRoss: Ah Joey, I don't think you get to pick the cities.ScenesJoey: What?ScenesRoss: Mr. Dickens gets to pick 'em.ScenesJoey: Who?ScenesChandler: I'll get you the Cliff Notes.ScenesJoey: The what?ScenesChandler: The abridgment.ScenesJoey: Oh, okay. (to Ross) The what?

rows.Scenes: Rachel's office, Mark is training Rachel.]
rows.Content: Mark: ...and the style number, and the invoice number, and the shipping date. Good. Any questions so far?ScenesRachel: Yeah. What kind of discount do we get?ScenesMark: Twenty percent.ScenesRachel: Oh!! I love this job! (her phone rings) Wow! My first call.ScenesMark: Here, let me. (answers phone) Rachel Green's line, how may I help you?ScenesRoss: (on phone) Hi, is Rachel there?ScenesMark: And who may I say is calling?ScenesRoss: This is Ross?ScenesMark: Ross of.....ScenesRoss: Of Ross and Rachel.ScenesMark: Oh hi. It's, it's Mark.ScenesRoss: Oh hey, hey Mark.ScenesMark: Hey, hold on a second.ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesRachel: Hi honey!ScenesRoss: Hi! What's ah, what's Mark doing answering your phone?ScenesRachel: Oh, he's just goofing around.ScenesRoss: Ohhhhh yeah, that's, that's funny. Why ah, why isn't he goofing around in his own office?ScenesRachel: Oh honey, this is his office too. I told you we're Joanna's two assistants.ScenesRoss: Why does Joanna need two assistants, how, how lazy is she?ScenesRachel: Oh! Oh my God! What did I just do?ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: I think I just shipped 3,000 bras to personnel. Oh honey, I gotta go. (to Mark) Mark, I need you!ScenesRoss: Okay, bye-bye. (starts slamming the receiver down in anger.)ScenesRachel: Ow! Ross!!ScenesRoss: Oh, oh, I'm, I'm, I'm sorry sweetie, I was just trying to ah, I'm dialing another number. (hangs up)

rows.Scenes: The Moondance diner, Monica is cleaning up with one of the waiters, with her back turned to him she removes her fake breasts and hides them under her wig.]
rows.Content: Jeannine: (to Monica) All right, I just got changed in thirty seconds so you can be alone with him. You'd better go for it.ScenesMonica: Please, I'm not going for anything.ScenesJeannine: Well, if you don't, I will.ScenesMonica: Would you please go?ScenesJeannine: Night Mon. Night Julio.ScenesJulio: (to Jeannine) Adios.Scenes(Monica starts wiping down the stools, as Julio follows along behind her replacing the napkin holders.)ScenesMonica: Look Julio, someone left their book here.ScenesJulio: Ah actually, that is mine.ScenesMonica: Oh yeah, what are you reading?ScenesJulio: Flowers of Evil, by Beaudalire. Have you read it?ScenesMonica: Have I read it? (pause) No, are you enjoying it?ScenesJulio: I thought I would, but the translation's no good.ScenesMonica: Your a poet and don't know it. (she turns away and makes a face like 'I can't believe I just said that.')ScenesJulio: Actually I ah, I am a poet.ScenesMonica: Oh, then you do know it. (pause) So um what kind of things do you write about?ScenesJulio: Things that move me. The, the shadow of a tree, a child laughing, or this lip. (points to her lip)ScenesMonica: Mine? (points to her lower lip) Right here?ScenesJulio: I can write an epic poem about this lip. (grabs her lower lip)ScenesMonica: How would that go? (they kiss) Well, it didn't rhyme, but I liked it.

rows.Scenes: Joey's audition.]
rows.Content: Joey: (singing) You've got to pick a pocket or two. Boyyyyssss, (picks a handkerchief from the pianist's pocket) you've got to pick a pocket or two..........ScenesDirector: Lovely, just lovely.ScenesJoey: Really? Thanks.ScenesDirector: Listen Joey, we definitely want to see you for the callback on Saturday.ScenesJoey: Excellent, I'll be there.ScenesDirector: Okay, and listen don't forget to bring your jazz shoes for the dance audition.ScenesJoey: Ahhh! My ah, my agent said it wasn't a dancing part.ScenesDirector: Joey, all the roles got to dance a little. But believe me with your dance background it'll be a piece of cake.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is reading Joey's resume.]
rows.Content: Chandler: ....three years of modern dance with Twila Tharp! Five years with the American Ballet Theater?!ScenesJoey: Hey, everybody lies on their resume, okay. I wasn't one of the Zoom Kids either.ScenesPhoebe: Well, can you dance at all?ScenesJoey: Yeah, I can dance, y'know.
