(laughs)ScenesChandler: You still can't stand her can you?ScenesJoey: I'm sorry man, I tired, I really did.ScenesChandler: Well, you know, I appreciate you giving it a shot.ScenesJoey: But, hey, look, you know the good thing is, is that we spent the whole day together and I survived, and what's even more amazing, so did she. It was bat day at Shea Stadium.ScenesChandler: Well, I guess that's something.ScenesJoey: No man, that's huge! Now, I know I can stand to be around her, which means I get to hang out with you, which is kinda the whole point, anyway.ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesJoey: Oh, hey, Chandler, we, ah, we stopped by the coffee shop and ran into Ross.ScenesChandler: Oh God!ScenesJoey: Hey, if it makes you feel any better, I do it too.ScenesChandler: Really?ScenesJoey: Oh yeah, I always picture your Mom when I'm having sex.

rows.Scenes: Rachel and Monica's, Monica is watching the Civil War videos]
rows.Content: Video:April Twelve, Eighteen hundred, Sixty-One (Monica lights Richard's cigar butt), 4:30 A.M. on Tuesday, the United States garrison at Fort Sumter was fired upon (knock on door) it is now under bombardment by....Scenes(Monica answers the door)ScenesMonica: Hi, Dad, what are you doing here?ScenesMr. Geller: Well, it's your mother's bridge night so I thought that I would come into the city for a little Monicuddle. (hugs her) Since when did you start smoking cigars?ScenesMonica: I don't, I just, I just like the smell of them. So, uh, what are you really doing here Dad?ScenesMr. Geller: Well, I just wanted to make sure you were okay.ScenesMonica: What makes you think that I might not be okay?ScenesMr. Geller: I saw Richard.ScenesMonica: Oh.ScenesMr. Geller: So, how are you doing?ScenesMonica: I'm fine, just a little tired, I'm okay. How's Richard doing?ScenesMr. Geller: You don't wanna know.ScenesMonica: No, I really, really do.ScenesMr. Geller: Well, he's doing terrible!ScenesMonica: Really!ScenesMr. Geller: Worse than when he broke up with Barbara.ScenesMonica: You're not just saying that are you?ScenesMr. Geller: No, the man is a mess.ScenesMonica: Was he crying?ScenesMr. Geller: No.ScenesMonica: Well, do you think he was waiting 'til after you left, so he could cry?ScenesMr. Geller: Maybe.ScenesMonica: I think so.ScenesMr. Geller: Honey, relationships are hard. Like with your Mom and me. You know after we graduated college we broke up for a while. It seems her Father, your Grandfather, wanted her to travel around Europe, like he did. Of course, he got to do it on Uncle Sam's nickel, because he was also strafing German troop trains at the time. However, (turns around and sees that Monica is sleeping and puts a blanket around her, kisses her, picks up the cigar, and starts watching the video)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Ross's bedroom, Ross is humming the Star Wars theme. Rachel enters, with her hair done up like Princess Leia's, and wearing a belly dancer's outfit, to simulate the gold bikini thing.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Okay, here we go. I'm Jabba's prisoner, and you have a really weird look on your face. What? Honey, what is it? Did I get it wrong? Did I get the hair wrong? What? Did you just picture it differently? What? What?ScenesRoss: No, no it's, um, it's not you, um, it's um, it's (turns and sees his Mom standing where Rachel is)ScenesMrs. Geller: Well what is it? Come on sweetie, your like, freaking me out here.ScenesRoss: I hate Chandler, the bastard ruined my life. (Rachel starts looking around and down, with a 'What the hell is going on?' look on her face.)ScenesEndScenesThe One Where No-one's ReadyScenesWritten by: Ira UngerleiderScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Rachel and Monica's, everyone is getting ready to go to a banquet]
rows.Content: Joey: All right they got water, orange juice, and what looks like cider. (takes a glass from the fridge.)ScenesChandler: Taste it.ScenesJoey: (drinks from the glass and puts it back in the fridge) Yep, it's fat. I drank fat!ScenesChandler: Yeah, I know, I did that two minutes ago.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey, mister tux!ScenesRoss: Why aren't you guys dressed?ScenesJoey: We have a half hour.ScenesRoss: No, four minutes ago you had a half hour, we have to be out the door at twenty to eight.ScenesJoey: Relax Ross, we'll be ready. It only takes us two minutes to get dressed.ScenesRoss: Well, you know, I'd feel a whole lot better if you got dressed now.ScenesChandler and Joey: Okay. (they don't move)ScenesRachel: (entering from bathroom) Hey-hey! Oh, look at you, all sexy.ScenesRoss: Really.ScenesRachel: Ooooh! Wow!! Oh, hi.ScenesRoss: Hi.ScenesRachel: How come you didn't come over earlier?ScenesRoss: 'Cause, I'm a stupid, stupid man.ScenesJoey: Hey, Ross, want some cider?ScenesRoss: No. (to Rachel) So, um, let's see your pretty close, huh. Make-up's on, hair's done.ScenesRachel: Yeah, I just have to get dressed.ScenesRoss: Yay! And that takes what? Just six or seven minutes.ScenesRachel: Yeah! Once, I figure out what I'm wearing.ScenesJoey: Glass of fat?ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's. Ross is acting nervous]
rows.Content: Joey: What's a matter Ross? What you're nervous about your speech?ScenesRoss: No! Do you wanna hear it?ScenesJoey: Am I in it?ScenesRoss: Uh, huh. Yeah, right after I thank everyone for giving money to the museum, I sing a song about the wonder that is Joey.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hello.ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesJoey: Whoa!ScenesRoss: Wow, hello! You look great!ScenesPhoebe: Thank you! I know, though.ScenesRoss: You see this, this is a person who is ready to go. Phoebe you, oh, you are my star.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, well, you're my lucky penny.ScenesChandler: (entering from bathroom, with an issue of Cosmo) All right, I took the quiz, and it turns out, I do put career before men. (to Joey) Get up.ScenesJoey: What?ScenesChandler: You're in my seat.ScenesJoey: How is this your seat?ScenesChandler: 'Cause I was sitting there.ScenesJoey: But then you left.ScenesChandler: Well, it's not like I went to Spain. I went to the bathroom, you knew I was coming back.ScenesJoey: What's the big deal, sit somewhere else.ScenesChandler: The big deal is I was sitting there last, so, that's my seat.ScenesJoey: Well, actually the last place you were sitting was in there (points to the bathroom). Soo...ScenesRoss: You guys, you know what, you know what, it doesn't matter, because you both have to go get dressed before the big vain in my head pops. So..ScenesChandler: All right, Ross, I just have to do one thing, really quickly, it's not a big deal. (yells at Joey) GET UP!!ScenesMonica: (entering) Hi.ScenesAll: Hey.ScenesMonica: Ooh, Phoebe, you look great!ScenesPhoebe: All right all ready.ScenesMonica: (to Ross) Ooh, are you gonna do magic?ScenesRoss: That's, that's funny. Change!ScenesMonica: Hang on a second I just got in.ScenesRoss: Look, I don't care it starts at eight, we can't be late.ScenesPhoebe: We could not, would not want to wait.ScenesRoss: Look, our table is down in front, okay, my boss is gonna be there, everyone will see if we arrive after it starts.ScenesMonica: Has somebody been drinking my fat? (Joey and Chandler look at each other)ScenesRachel: (entering from her bedroom) You guys, (holds up an outfit) does this look like something the girlfriend of a paleontologist would wear?ScenesPhoebe: I don't know, you might be the first one.ScenesMonica: Rach, did you check the machine?ScenesRachel: Uh, no. Wait, you know what, this is the outfit that makes my calves look fat. Nevermind.ScenesChandler: Well, Joey, I wrote a little song today. It's called: Get Up.ScenesJoey: All right! You can have the chair.ScenesChandler: Really!ScenesJoey: Oh my, would you look at that! (holds up crossed fingers)ScenesPhoebe: (on machine) "Hi, it's me, I'm coming over now. Hey, what if I'm already there when your playing this message?" (to the guys) Is that too spooky?ScenesRoss: (on machine) "Hi Rach, are you there? It's me, pick up. Rachel. Rach!ScenesRachel: (entering from her bedroom) What?!ScenesRoss: Nevermind.ScenesRichard: (on machine) "Monica, it's Richard. Call me.ScenesMonica: Is-is-is that message old or new? (yelling) Old or new?! Old or new?!ScenesRoss: It's old, it's definitely old. Didn't you hear the, the double beep?ScenesMonica: What if it's new? I mean, we agreed not to talk again, unless we had something really important to say. Shouldn't I call him back?ScenesChandler: Honey, you did call him back. 'Cause, it's, it's really old.ScenesRoss: Yeah, see Mon, listen, listen. When Carol and I broke up, I went through the same thing. And you know what I did?ScenesMonica: Huh?ScenesRoss: I.....got.....dressed. Really, really quickly. Okay, okay. (Rachel starts to follow Monica into her room, but Ross stops her and sends her back to her room.) There we go, there we go.ScenesChandler: You know what, okay, fine. Don't get up, you just sit right there. I just hope, you don't mind, you know, my hand right here. (holds his hand a couple of inches in front of Joey's face) Op, not touching, can't get mad! Not touching can't get mad! Not touching can't get mad! (Joey flings some dip onto Phoebe's dress)ScenesPhoebe: Ah! Oh my God! You r-r-rotten boys!ScenesChandler and Joey: Sorry Phoebe.ScenesJoey: I'm so sorry.ScenesPhoebe: What am I gonna do?ScenesRoss: No, no, don't, don't, rub it! Don't! (clapping) What gets out hummus?! What gets out hummus?!ScenesPhoebe: Monica, Monica, you know what gets out hummus.ScenesMonica: If it is a new message, what is he calling to say?ScenesPhoebe: Okay, thanks. Yeah, I'll try that.ScenesChandler: Maybe he's calling to say your obsessive and crazy.ScenesMonica: So, should I call him back?ScenesThe Guys: Noo! (Monica starts to go back into her room and stops) NO!ScenesChandler: All right, fine, you know what, we'll both sit in the chair. (sits on Joey's lap) I'm soooo, comfortable.ScenesJoey: Me too. In fact, I think I might be a little too comfortable.ScenesChandler: All right! (jumps up)ScenesRoss: Okay, look, we have nineteen minutes. Okay, Chandler, I want you to go and change! Okay. And then, when you come back, Joey will go change, and he'll have vacated the chair. Okay. Okay.ScenesChandler: All right! Fine! I'm going. But when I get back it's chair sitting, and I'm the guy who's....sitting in a chair! (leaves)ScenesRachel: (entering from her room) Is this a little too... (sees Phoebe) Pheebs, what happened?ScenesPhoebe: Hummus. I got the hummus.ScenesRachel: Ooooh! Honey, well we'll find you something. Do you wanna wear my black jacket?ScenesPhoebe: That won't go with this dress though.ScenesRachel: No, you're right. Well, we'll find something. Let's just get you out of that. Come on.ScenesRoss: No, no, no, no, no, no, not out of that, not out of clothes.ScenesRachel: Monica, can Phoebe borrow your green dress?ScenesMonica: I called him.ScenesAll: Nooo.ScenesMonica: Yes. Well I got his machine and I left a message. But it's okay, it's okay, it's okay, because you know it was like a casual, breezy message. It was breezy! Oh God, what if it wasn't breezy?ScenesPhoebe: Well, how could it not be breezy, no, 'cause, you're, you're in such a breezy place.ScenesMonica: Here, I got it. I'll will play my message for you guys, and you can tell me if it's breezy enough.ScenesJoey: Monica, how are you gonna do that?ScenesMonica: I know the code to his answering machine.ScenesRoss: Okay, Mon, I really don't think this is the... Okay, you're dialing, you are dialing.Scenes(Chandler enters, and Joey is standing near the chair, they have a show down to see who gets the chair and Joey wins)ScenesRichard: (on machine) "Hi, this is Richard. Please, leave a message at the tone.ScenesMachine: "You have two new messages.ScenesJoey: Wow, what a cool job. (in a machine voice) 'You have two new messages.' 'Please, pass the pie.'ScenesMonica: (on machine) "Hi, it's Monica. I'm just checking in 'cause I got this message from you and I didn't know if it was old or new or what. So, I'm just checkin'. So let me know, or don't, whatever. I'm breezy.ScenesJoey: Hey, you can't say you're breezy, that, that totally negates the breezy.ScenesWoman's Voice: (on machine) Hola, it's me, yesterday was really fun. Call me about this weekend, okay.ScenesJoey: Now she sounded breezy.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier]
rows.Content: Monica: He's seeing someone. I can't believe he's seeing someone.ScenesPhoebe: Monica, you don't know that.ScenesMonica: Well, who's voice was that?ScenesChandler: Maybe it was his sister's. You know, maybe it was his daughter's.ScenesMonica: Michelle! Of course, it was Michelle! Did it sound like Michelle?ScenesRoss: Oh, great. It's starting to rain, that will make it easy to get a cab.ScenesMonica: It was Michelle. It was definitely Michelle.ScenesRachel: Pheebs, you go with Monica and try on her green dress. If that doesn't work, you can wear my gray silk one. Oh, gosh, what am I wearing?!ScenesRoss: You don't, you don't know what your wearing?ScenesRachel: Well, hon-ey. I'm just trying to look nice for your big night.ScenesRoss: Yeah, which, which we have to leave for in exactly twelve minutes. All right, come on, I'll just pick something out for you.ScenesChandler: All right, you will notice that I am fully dressed. I, in turn, have noticed that you are not. So in the words of A. A. Milne, "Get out of my chair, dillhole!ScenesJoey: Okay. (he gets up and takes the cushions with him, as he starts to leave)ScenesChandler: What are you doing?ScenesJoey: You said I had to give you the chair, you didn't say anything about the cushions.ScenesChandler: The cushions are the essence of the chair!ScenesJoey: That's right! I'm taking the essence.ScenesChandler: Oh-ho, it'll be back. Oh-ho, there's nobody in the room.ScenesRoss: Look, I'm sorry, I thought it looked pretty.ScenesRachel: Ross, that was a Halloween costume, unless you would like me to go to this thing as Little Bo Peep.ScenesRoss: Look, I didn't recognize it without that inflatable sheep.ScenesRachel: Yeah, which, by the way Chandler, I would like back one of these days.ScenesPhoebe: Oh Rach, good, listen isn't this perfect for me! (she's wearing another dress on a hanger around her neck)ScenesRachel: Oh, it's perfect! But not for tonight.ScenesPhoebe: Well, of course not for tonight. Yeah, hi!ScenesRoss: Not for tonight. Not for tonight! Wh-what, what, what, are you doing?ScenesRachel: No honey, we're sorry, we didn't mean it. I love you. I love you.ScenesChandler: We used them as pillows when we went camping.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesChandler: (shyly) The sheep.ScenesRoss: Hey, what you do on your own time...ScenesJoey: (entering) Where's my underwear?!ScenesRoss: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Come on, come on, what. You took his underwear?ScenesChandler: He took my essence!ScenesRoss: Okay, now hold on. Joey, why, why can't you just wear the underwear you're wearing now?ScenesJoey: Because, I'm not wearing any underwear now.ScenesRoss: Okay, then why do you have to wear underwear tonight?ScenesJoey: It's a rented tux. Okay. I'm not gonna go commando in another man's fatigues.ScenesChandler: Well, then it looks like somebody is gonna have to give back somebody his cushions.ScenesJoey: Okay, you hide my clothes. I'm gonna do the exact opposite to you.ScenesChandler: What are you, what are you gonna show me my clothes?ScenesJoey: Hey, opposite, is opposite! (leaves)ScenesChandler: He's got nothing!ScenesPhoebe: (entering from Rachel's room, wearing a huge bow to cover the stain) Okay, I'm ready.ScenesRoss and Chandler: Oh, aaaah!ScenesPhoebe: Rachel, didn't have anything that I liked, so, but she had this Christmas ribbon, and I thought, 'All right, fine I'll be political.'ScenesChandler: What are you supporting?ScenesPhoebe: Duh!! Christmas!ScenesRoss: Okay, hey, that's okay with me. Two down and I have exactly twelve minutes.... Wha, my watch stopped. My watch. (shows Chandler) Okay, see, the, the dinosaur tail isn't going around any more. (grabs Chandler's watch) What time is it? It's 7:33, I have seven minutes. I have seven minutes!!ScenesRachel: (entering from her room) Okay, Pheebs, quick, what shoes should I wear? The black or the purple?ScenesRoss: Just, just, just pick one!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, okay, okay, the black. But, oh, do you have black, with the little strappys?ScenesRachel: Yeahh, but, but those really go better with pants. Maybe I should wear pants?ScenesRoss: Yeah, pants, what, what an idea. Or better yet, um, how 'bout you go without any pants. Look, I don't know what you're trying to do to me, but just get your butt in there and pick out any shoes that fit your feet, okay. No, no I don't care if they match. I don't care if they make your ankles or your knees or your earlobes look fat. Okay.ScenesRachel: But I...ScenesRoss: No, no, no just do it. Go in there and pick something out so we can go.ScenesRachel: All right.ScenesRoss: Thank you!ScenesMonica: (entering from her room) Okay. I gotta call Michelle. I gotta see if that was her voice or not. I'm sorry, I just have to.ScenesRoss: It was, it was her voice.ScenesChandler: Monica, I think you've gone over to the bad place.ScenesMichelle: Hola! Hello. Hello?ScenesMonica: Okay. That was her right?ScenesPhoebe: Definitely.ScenesMonica: See there you go. Woo! We're out of the woods. Okay, I'll get dressed now.ScenesRoss: Yay!Scenes(phone rings)ScenesPhoebe: I'll get it, okay. (answers phone) Hi, Monica and Rachel's. (listens) Yeah, just a second, can I ask who's calling. (to Monica) Oh, ew, it's Michelle! Ew! She, she must have that Caller Id thing. You should get that.ScenesMonica: (on phone) Uh, Michelle. Yeah, that was me, I-I dialed your number by mistake. (listens) Oh, you're so sweet. Yeah, we were a great couple. I know I really miss him. Well, you know how it is, it's that....ScenesChandler: (to Phoebe) You know what's weird. Donald Duck never wore pants. But whenever he's getting out of the shower, he always put a towel around his waist. I mean, what is that about?ScenesMonica: (on phone) Michelle, I only beeped in so I could hear my message. I mean that's allowed. Yeah-huh! I mean look, yeah, you know what I would really appreciate it if you didn't tell your Dad about. What do you mean, you're not comfortable with this? Come on we're friends!! (Michelle hangs up) That bitch always hated me. I'm calling her back.ScenesRoss: No, no, no, no. Tick, tick, tick, tick.ScenesMonica: Okay, fine. (runs to her room)ScenesChandler: They got a phone in there, right?ScenesPhoebe: Okay, we're on it. We're on it.Scenes(Rachel comes out from her room wearing sweat pants and a sweatshirt)ScenesRoss: Um. I know it says black tie optional, but, um this may be pushing it a little, um.ScenesRachel: I'm not gonna gooo.ScenesRoss: You're not going to go.ScenesRachel: No, I think I'm gonna catch up on my correspondence.ScenesRoss: How, how, um how can you not be going?ScenesRachel: I'm not gonna gooo, so I think that will accomplish the not going.ScenesRoss: Um, you know, just out of curiosity...ScenesRachel: Well, ever since I was humiliated and yelled at in front of my friends, I'm just, I don't know, not in a museum benefitty kind of mood.ScenesRoss: Right. Right, okay, okay. I'm sorry. I'm sorry I yelled.ScenesRachel: It's fine.ScenesRoss: No, but, your-your mad.ScenesRachel: I'm not mad.ScenesRoss: No.ScenesRachel: I'm just not going.ScenesRoss: Your not going.ScenesRachel: Right.ScenesRoss: Okay. You know that I-I have to go.ScenesRachel: Um, hum.ScenesRoss: Right. So is it gonna be like 'I'm abandoning you while your upset.'ScenesRachel: No.ScenesRoss: No, because your not upset.ScenesRachel: Right.ScenesRoss: About the yelling.ScenesRachel: Right, and the humiliating.ScenesRoss: Oh, well of course, the humiliating. So, so wee, we're okay.ScenesRachel: Um, hum.ScenesRoss: We're good.ScenesRachel: Right.ScenesRoss: Okay. Honey?ScenesRachel: Yes, Ross. (turns toward him)ScenesRoss: I love you. (goes to kiss her and she turns away.)ScenesPhoebe: (yelling from the bedroom) Get away from that! No! (she comes into the living room carrying the phone) She's just getting dressed.ScenesChandler: Is it wrong that I was totally aroused by that?Scenes(Joey enters wearing a lot of clothes)ScenesJoey: Okay, buddy-boy. Here it is. You hide my clothes, I'm wearing everything you own.ScenesChandler: Oh my God! That is so not the opposite of taking somebody's underwear!!ScenesJoey: Look at me! I'm Chandler! Could I be wearing any more clothes? Maybe if I wasn't going commando...ScenesChandler: Oooo-ooh!ScenesJoey: Yeah. Whew, it's hot with all of this stuff on. I ah, I better not do any, I don't know, lunges. (starts doing lunges)ScenesRoss: Okay, okay. Enough, enough with the lunging. No! I'm sick of this. Okay. I've had it up to here with you two! Neither you can come to the party!ScenesChandler: Jeez, what a baby.ScenesJoey: Yeah, Ross, way to ruin it. I was just going to get dressed.ScenesRoss: You know what I don't care. The only person I cared about getting dressed, is the one person that says she's not even gonna go. Look Rach, I'm sorry. Okay. Look, I-I wa, I was a jerk. I'm sorry I yelled. I want you there, I need you there. Look, what, what can I do that can show you how much, how much I want you to be there.ScenesJoey: You could drink the fat.ScenesRoss: Hi, welcome, to an adult conversation.ScenesRachel: No, no, no, now wait, wa, wa, waa-it a minute, wait a minute, wait a minute, wait a minute. That actually, uh, that sounds interesting.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: I think you should drink the fat.ScenesJoey: Yaaaay!ScenesRoss: Okay, okay. If that is what it takes to show you how much you mean to me, and how much I want you there. Then that's what I'll do.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, wait, let me get you another glass. That's been sitting out.ScenesRoss: I think this will be fine. Okay, vanilla milkshake, just a vanilla milkshake, with chicken bits floating in it. Cheers. (starts to drink, but Rachel stops him just before he starts drinking)ScenesRachel: No, no, no, wait! Okay, okay. Don't! I'll go, I'll go!ScenesRoss: You will?!ScenesRachel: You were really gonna do that, weren't you?ScenesRoss: Well, yeah.ScenesRachel: You were gonna drink the fat.ScenesJoey: Let's see what else he'll do!ScenesRoss: (to Joey) How 'bout instead you, go get changed! (to Chandler) You, give him back his underwear! I'm gonna go get a cab, and I want everyone down stairs in two minutes! Monica!Scenes(Joey and Chandler start to leave, Joey is lunging as he is walking)ScenesChandler: Stop it. Stop it!Scenes(Monica runs into the living room, and starts dialing the phone)ScenesPhoebe: Ross, went to get a cab so we can all... No, wh-what are you doing! No, Monica, no!ScenesRichard: (on machine) Hi, this is Richard.ScenesMachine: You have three new messages.ScenesMonica: Not any more!ScenesMachine: Message erased. To record a message begin speaking at the tone.ScenesMonica: Hi, uh, Richard it's Monica, um, listen I did something kind of crazy tonight, um, maybe I'm getting my period or something, I don't know. Um, anyway, I, I, I beeped into your machine and I heard a message that, that freaked me out, and um, you know what Michelle will tell you the rest. I, I, um, I'm sorry, okay, I, I hope that we can forget the whole thing. Okay, bye.ScenesMachine: Your outgoing message has now been changed.ScenesMonica: Outgoing! Did that say outgoing?! Not, outgoing!!!ScenesMonica: (on machine) "Hi, uh, Richard it's Monica, um, listen I did something kind of crazy tonight, um, maybe I'm getting my period or something, I don't know." Nooo!!ScenesPhoebe: How did you do that?ScenesMonica: I don't know!ScenesMachine: Good-bye.ScenesMonica: Noooo!!!!ScenesRoss: (entering) Okay, okay, okay, I've got two cabs and no people. Go! Go! Go!ScenesMonica: Maybe we could call the phone company. Maybe they could change the message. Maybe they can change his number.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, after this, I think he'll be doing that himself.ScenesRoss: Rachel!! (she enters) Wow! You, uh, you look, wow!ScenesRachel: And I still have about five seconds to spare. (kisses him) Okay, that was about seven seconds.ScenesRoss: So we're a little late.ScenesRachel: Come on. (they start to leave) Oh! And, uh, by the way....ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: I'm going commando, too.ScenesRoss: Awwww!!!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: At the banquet]
rows.Content: Sherman Whitfield: Dr. Geller, Sherman Whitfield, London Institute.ScenesRoss: Wow! What a pleasure.ScenesWhitfield: (sits down) Well, I have to tell you, I was quite impressed with your paper on Pre-Cretaceous fossils. Yeah, it confirmed everything that I have written.ScenesChandler: Excuse me. Hi.ScenesWhitfield: Yes?ScenesChandler: Well, your kind of sitting in my seat.ScenesWhitfield: What do you mean, your seat?ScenesChandler: I mean, I was sitting there.ScenesWhitfield: But, you got up!ScenesChandler: But, I never left the room!ScenesWhitfield: But, you left the chair area.ScenesChandler: All right, that's it, give me your underwear.ScenesEndScenesThe One With the JamScenesWritten by: Wil CalhounScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is sitting reading a book and hears the bed in Joey's room creaking, and does a 'Oh no, not again' look on his face.]
rows.Content: Joey: (from bedroom) WHOAA!!ScenesChandler: (going to the bedroom) See Joe, that's why your parents told you not to jump on the bed.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Rachel are entering]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey, look at me. I'm making jam, been at it since 4 o'clock this morning.ScenesRoss: Where'd you get fruit at four in the morning?ScenesMonica: Went down to the docks. Bet ya didn't know you could get it wholesale.ScenesRachel: I didn't know there were docks.Scenes[Joey and Chandler enter]ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesRoss: Aww, is it broken?ScenesJoey: No, I gotta wear this thing for a couple weeks. (points to the sling he is wearing)ScenesRachel: Did you tell the doctor you did it jumping up and down on your bed?ScenesJoey: Nooo. I had a story all worked out but then Chandler sold me out.ScenesChandler: Well, I'm sorry Joe. I didn't think the doctor was gonna buy that it just *fell* out of the socket.ScenesJoey: What is this? Fruit?ScenesRachel: Monica's making jam.ScenesJoey: Whoa, jam! I love jam! (to Chandler) Hey, how come we never have jam at our place?ScenesChandler: Because the kids need new shoes.ScenesMonica: I'm going into business people. I'm sick and tired of being depressed about Richard. I needed a plan, a plan to get over my man. What's the opposite of man? Jam. (sees Joey trying some jam from the pot) Oh Joey don't! It's way to hot. (Joey realizes this and spits what he had in his mouth back into the pot.)ScenesJoey: This will just be my batch.

rows.Scenes: Street, Phoebe is being followed by some guy, as they pass a flower vendor. Phoebe turns around and the guy quickly picks up some flowers and continues following her.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (turns around) Um, that's it. No. Hey! You! J. Crew guy. Yeah. Why have you been following me? I mean, all week long everywhere I look there's you.ScenesGuy: You wouldn't return my calls, you sent back my letters....ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesGuy: One more chance Ursula, please?ScenesPhoebe: Oooh. Oh, well this is awkward.ScenesGuy: Wh..ScenesPhoebe: Um, yeah, you want Ursula, and I'm Phoebe. Twin sisters! Seriously.ScenesGuy: Oh, that's great. I'm stalking the wrong woman. I am such a dingus!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, you're not a dingus.ScenesGuy: I just, I want you to know I didn't used to be like this. Before I meet your sister I was like this normal guy who sold beepers and cellular phones.ScenesPhoebe: Well, I mean look it's, it's not your fault, you know. I mean this is just what, what she does to guys, okay.ScenesGuy: Well thanks. (starts to leave)ScenesPhoebe: Wait, (grabs him) you know what, I got a little story. When I was in Junior High School I went through this period where I thought I was a witch. And there was this guidance counselor who said something to me, that I think will help you a lot. He said okay, 'you're not a witch you're just an average student.' See what I'm saying?ScenesGuy: Not really.ScenesPhoebe: Um, well, get over it. So, I mean you, you just seem to be a really nice guy, you know. Don't be so hard on yourself okay.ScenesGuy: Wait. You're right. I know you're right. And, thanks for being so nice. Here (gives her the flowers he bought.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, thanks a lot. Do you want to get a cup of coffee?ScenesGuy: Yeah, okay.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (they start to leave, he is still following her) Okay, you don't have to walk behind me any more.ScenesGuy: Sorry.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Rachel are entering]
rows.Content: Rachel: Mon?ScenesRoss: Mon?ScenesRachel: (reading) 'Gone for more jars. Back later. Monica Geller.'ScenesRoss: Wait a minute, look.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesRoss: Look, look, look.ScenesRachel: What, what, what?ScenesRoss: It's an empty apartment.ScenesRachel: Oooh.ScenesRoss: We're all alone in an empty apartment.ScenesRachel: Honey, come on, I have to be at work in like ten minutes (Ross starts kissing her neck) Oh, all right, well it's not like I'm employee of the year or anything. (they fall onto the couch)Scenes(Chandler enters and they both jump up and pretend that Ross is showing her something in the couch.)ScenesRoss: There it is.ScenesRachel: Oh, oh, that's what you're talking about. (to Chandler) Hey.ScenesRoss: Hey.ScenesChandler: Do I look fat?ScenesRoss and Rachel: Noo.ScenesChandler: Okay, I accept that. When Janice asked me and I said no, she took that to mean that I was calling her a cow.ScenesRachel: Okay, walk us through it, honey, walk us through it.ScenesChandler: Okay, well. Janice said 'Hi, do I look fat today?' And I, I looked at her....ScenesRoss: Whoa, whoa, whoa. You looked at her. You never look. You just answer, it's just a reflex. Do I look fat? Nooo! Is she prettier than I am? Noo! Does size matter?ScenesRachel: Nooo!ScenesRoss: And it works both ways.ScenesChandler: Okay, so you both just know this stuff?ScenesRachel: Well you know, after about thirty or forty fights, you kinda catch on.ScenesRoss: Okay, for instance. Let's say, Janice is coming back from a trip and she gives you two options. Option number 1 she'll take a cab home from the airport. Option 2 is you can meet her at baggage claim. Which do you do?ScenesChandler: That's easy, baggage claim.ScenesRoss: (buzzes) Wrong! Now you're single. It's actually secret option number three, you meet her at the gate. That way she knows you love her.ScenesChandler: Okay, this is good, this is good. All right listen, I have one. Janice likes to cuddle, at night, which, you know I'm all for. But, uh, you know when you want to go to sleep, you want some space. So, uh, how do I tell her that without, you know, accidentally calling her fat or something.ScenesRachel: Oh honey, I'm sorry we can't help you there, 'cause we're cuddlily sleepers. (Chandler makes an 'Ewww' face) Okay, I'm late for work.ScenesRoss: Oh.ScenesRachel: All right are you guys gonna come down?ScenesRoss: Uh, yeah, yeah I'll, I'm right behind you.ScenesRachel: Good luck Chandler.ScenesChandler: Thank you Rachel.ScenesRoss: Bye sweetie.ScenesRachel: Bye hon.ScenesRoss: (blows her a kiss) Okay the sleeping thing. Very tricky business, but there is something you can do.ScenesChandler: Well, I thought you guys were cuddlily sleepers.ScenesRoss: Noo! No, not cuddlily, not me, just her. I'm like you, I need the room. Okay, come here. (they sit on the couch and Ross puts his hands on Chandler's shoulder and thigh.) Okay, you're in bed...ScenesChandler: Yeah. (they both notice where his hands are)ScenesRoss: I'm gonna use the cushion.ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Okay, you're in bed. She's over on your side, cuddling. Now you wait for her to drift off, and then you hug her (demonstrates on the cushion) and roll her back over to her side of the bed. And then you rollll a-way. Hug for her! Roll for you.ScenesChandler: Okay, the old hug and roll.ScenesRoss: Yep.ScenesChandler: Okay, one question.ScenesRoss: Shoot.ScenesChandler: You're pretending the pillow's a girl right?

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is putting jam on his muffin, lots of jam]
rows.Content: Joey: Remember when you where a kid and your Mom would drop you off at the movies with a jar of jam and a little spoon?ScenesRachel: (Looks at him) You're so pretty.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hi!ScenesAll: Hey, Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: Hey, oh, you know that guy who's been following me? I talked to him today.ScenesJoey: (with food in his mouth) You talked to him. Are you crazy?ScenesPhoebe: Okay, first I'm not crazy. And second, say it don't spray it. Anyway his name is Malcom, and he wasn't following me, I mean he was, but 'cause he thought I was Ursula, ick. And, that's why, that's why he couldn't just come up and talk to me. 'Cause of the restraining order.ScenesChandler: Umm, not feeling better 'bout Malcom.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh! No, no, no, no, he's not like a kook, no. He's just like this, this very passionate, incredibly romantic guy, that got like a tinsy bit carried away, you know. And we just get along really well, and he's so cute.ScenesRoss: Oh my God, you've got a crush on your sister's stalker.ScenesPhoebe: No, I'm just gonna help him, you know, get 'de-Ursula-ized', like you know, like I did for Joey after he went out with her.ScenesJoey: (with his mouthful) Hey, I didn't stalk her. I mean (he sprays Phoebe with crumbs)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I asked for the news, not the weather.ScenesMonica: (entering) Hey guys.ScenesAll: Hey Mon.ScenesMonica: Joey, this is for you. (gives him a jar of jam) It's blackberry curin.ScenesJoey: Aww. (tastes it) Ohh!ScenesChandler: Hey, Joe, I gotta ask. The girl from the Xerox place buck naked (holds up one hand), or, or a big tub of jam. (holds up the other hand)ScenesJoey: Put your hands together.ScenesMonica: Joey, take your time with that. That's my last batch.ScenesJoey: No more jam?!ScenesRachel: Well, what happened to your jam plan?ScenesMonica: I figured out I need to charge seventeen bucks a jar just to break even. So, I've got a new plan now. Babies.ScenesChandler: Well, your gonna need much bigger jars.ScenesRoss: What are you talking about?ScenesMonica: I'm talking about me having a baby.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: Are you serious?ScenesMonica: Yeah. The great thing about the jam plan was, I was taking control of my life. So I asked myself, what is the most important thing to me in the world and that's when I came up with the baby plan.ScenesRoss: Well, aren't you forgetin' something? What, what, what is uh, what is that guy's name? Dad!ScenesMonica: It took me 28 years to find one man that I wanna spend my life with, if I have to wait another 28 years then, I'll be 56 before I can have a baby, and that's just stupid.ScenesChandler: That, that's what's stupid.ScenesMonica: I don't need an actual man, just a couple of his best swimmers. And there, there are places you can go to get that stuff.ScenesRachel: Down at the docks again?

rows.Scenes: Chandler's bedroom, Janice and him are cuddling]
rows.Content: Janice: Night-night Bing-a-ling.ScenesChandler: Night-night.....Janice. (he starts thinking to him self) 'Look at all that room on her side, you good fit a giant penguin over there. That would be weird though. Okay, hug and roll time. I'm huggin', I'm huggin', your rollin', and....yes! Freedom! (his one arm is still under her) Except for this arm! I'm stuck. Stuck arm! Okay, time for the old table cloth trick, one fluid motion. Quick like a cat, quick like a cat! And 1...2...3!' (Pulls his arm out from under her and she is spun off of the bed.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Malcom is giving Phoebe all of his spy stuff]
rows.Content: Malcom: Here's my binoculars.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, great. Great. You're doing great, you know real strong. Going strong. Keep going.ScenesMalcom: These are my night vision goggles. This is the book I pretend to read when I'm watching her in the park. And these are Mad Lips, they're just for fun.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yeah. What's this? (picks up a book)ScenesMalcom: Oh, this is log I kept, recording her every movement. Do you wanna here something from it?ScenesPhoebe: Um, not even a little bit.ScenesMalcom: It's about you.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, okay then.ScenesMalcom: (reading) I met Phoebe today. She was really nice to me eventhough I'm such a loser. And, then when I was walking home I thought about her a lot, it was weird, but kinda cool.ScenesPhoebe: Good. So what were you thinking?ScenesMalcom: I was thinking what it would be like to kiss you.ScenesPhoebe: Really?ScenesMalcom: No.ScenesPhoebe: Oh.ScenesMalcom: See that's just something I said now, so that maybe I could kiss you.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, okay. (he kisses her)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is eating jam straight out of the jar, and Chandler is staring at him in amazement. Joey offers him some.]
rows.Content: Chandler: No, that's all right. I just had a jar of mustard.ScenesMonica: (entering from her bedroom) Okay, sperm donor number 03815, come on down! Okay, he's 6'2", 170 pounds, and he describes himself as a male Geena Davis.ScenesChandler: You mean there's more than one of us.ScenesRoss: Look, you can't do this Mon. All right, if you do this, I'm, I'm gonna, I'm, I'm gonna.....ScenesMonica: You're gonna what?ScenesRoss: I'm gonna tell Mom.ScenesRachel: Honey, I'm sorry, but he's right. I love you, but you're crazy.ScenesRoss: Crazy.ScenesMonica: What?! Why? Why is this crazy? So this isn't the ideal way to something....ScenesRoss: (interrupting her) Oh, it's not the ideal way...ScenesMonica: Lips moving, still talking. I mean it may not be ideal, but I'm so ready. No, I-I-I see the way Ben looks at you. It makes me ache, you know?ScenesJoey: Check it out!! Jam crackers!ScenesMonica: Okay, all right, how's this? 27. Italian-American guy. He's an actor, born in Queens. Wow, big family, seven sisters, and he's the only....boy. (they all turn and look at Joey) Oh my God, under personal comments: 'New York Knicks, rule!'ScenesJoey: Yeah, the Knicks rule!ScenesMonica: Joey, this is you!ScenesJoey: Let me see. (goes over and looks at the form) Oh, right.ScenesRachel: When did you go to a sperm bank?ScenesJoey: Well, right after I did that sex study down at NYU. (to Chandler) Hey, Remember that sweater I gave you for your birthday?ScenesChandler: And that's how you bought it?ScenesJoey: Noooo, that's what I was wearing when I donated. I'm kinda surprised there's any of my boys left.ScenesMonica: Well, honey, it is pretty competitive. I mean I've got an actual rocket scientist here.ScenesJoey: Maybe, I should call this place and get them to put my 'Days of Our Lives' on here. You know, juice this puppy up a little.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hellooo!ScenesAll: Hey.ScenesRoss: How's the maniac?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, well he's yummy. We did a little kissin'.ScenesRachel: Phoebe, what are you doing?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, no, no, no, no. You know what, he's not into that stuff anymore. He quit for me.ScenesRachel: Pheebs, this guy has been obsessed with your sister, for God knows how long, okay, you don't just give up something like that.ScenesPhoebe: Look, he gave me his night vision goggles and everything.ScenesRoss: You're taking the word of a guy who has night vision goggles?ScenesPhoebe: What, he's not still following her. Do you think he is still following her?ScenesChandler: Pheebs, wake up and smell the restraining order.ScenesPhoebe: What are you saying I should do?ScenesMonica: I think, that if you really like this guy, you should just trust him.ScenesPhoebe: Thank you, Monica.ScenesJoey: Orrr, you could follow him and see where he goes.ScenesMonica: Oh, that's what I would do, forget mine.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh my God, what happened? (points to the cast on Janice's wrist)ScenesJanice: Oh. God, crazy Chandler. He spun me...off...the...bed!ScenesRachel: Wow! Spinning that sounds like fun.ScenesJanice: Oh, (laughs) I wish. No, you know he was just trying Ross's Hug and Roll thing.ScenesRachel: (turns around, not amused) Ross's what?ScenesJanice: You know what, where he hugs you and kinda rolls you away and... Oh... my....God.

rows.Scenes: Subway station, Phoebe is following Malcom by finding behind the pillars until she comes up to one with a wire mesh garbage can next to it. Malcom stops and starts walking the other way and passes Phoebe, who quick tries to hide behind the garbage can. But, Malcom sees her.]
rows.Content: Malcom: Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: Yes? Yes! Oh.ScenesMalcom: What are you doing?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I was just here looking for, um, my um, my part of an old sandwich. Oh, here it is! Oh. (picks one up out of the garbage can.)ScenesMalcom: Were you following me?ScenesPhoebe: Um, perhaps. Yes! Yes, I'm sorry, I'm sorry. I was just afraid that you were still hung up on my sister.ScenesMalcom: So you spied on me. I can't believe you don't trust me. (Ursula walks past, and Malcom finds behind the pillar)ScenesPhoebe: Oh well, what do you know, there goes my identical twin sister. Just walkin' along looking like me. What, is this just like a freakish coincidence, or did you know she takes this train?ScenesMalcom: I'm sorry. I'm sorry. I tried to stop, but I couldn't. I'm so pathetic.ScenesPhoebe: No, no, it's not your fault. You know it's partly my fault, 'cause I made you quit cold turkey. Sorry, no. Okay, well, I mean, I can't date you anymore, 'cause your, you know (in a high pitched voice) Wow! But um, but I will definitely, definitely help you get over my sister. Okay, stalk me for a while. Huh? Yeah, and, and, and, I'll be like an Ursula patch.ScenesMalcom: Uh-huh, I don't know.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, just, okay, look I'm going. Um, come on. Op, op, behind the pillar, which way am I gonna go?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is entering]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey.ScenesMonica: Hey.ScenesJoey: Where you going?ScenesMonica: To the bank.ScenesJoey: Sperm or regular?ScenesMonica: Sperm.ScenesJoey: So you're really doing this, huh?ScenesMonica: Oh yeah, picked a guy, 37135.ScenesJoey: Sounds nice.ScenesMonica: 'Fraid so. Brown hair, green eyes...ScenesJoey: No kiddin', hmm.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesJoey: No, I-I figured you would've picked a blond guy.ScenesMonica: Really? Why?ScenesJoey: I don't know, I just always pictured you ending up with one of those tall, smart blond guys, name like.... Hoyt.ScenesMonica: Hoyt?ScenesJoey: It's a name, yeah. I saw you, you know, in this great house with a big pool.ScenesMonica: Really, is he a swimmer?ScenesJoey: He's got the body for it.ScenesMonica: I like that. (Joey starts laughing) What?ScenesJoey: You guys have one of those signs that says: 'We don't swim in your toilet, so don't pee in our pool.', you know.ScenesMonica: We do not have one of those signs.ScenesJoey: Sure you do, it was a gift from me. Oh! And you have these three great kids.ScenesMonica: Two girls and a boy?ScenesJoey: Yeah!ScenesMonica: And, and, and they wear those little water wings, you know. And they're, they're running around on the deck. Then Hoyt wraps this big towel around all three of them.ScenesJoey: Sure! (Monica gets very depressed) But hey, you know this way sounds good too.ScenesMonica: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Oh Monica. (goes over and hugs her, then looks at the form and stops hugging her.) Wow, this guy's an astronaut. That would've been cool, (sees Monica) for like a day. (hugs her again).ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is finishing off the last of the jam]
rows.Content: Joey: I called the sperm bank today, they haven't sold a single unit of Tribianni. Nobody wants my product. I mean, I-I-I don't get it (tries to drink the rest of the jam out of the jar and gets it all over his face, on his chin, nose, etc.) Maybe if they met me in person.ScenesRachel: Honey, you got a little thing on your...(points to her whole face)ScenesJoey: (wipes a little jam from the corner of his mouth) Did I get it?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hello.ScenesRachel: Hello.ScenesRoss: (sees Joey) Hey. (walks into the living room) Uh, Chan, can I uh, can I talk to you for a second?ScenesChandler: Sure. What's up?ScenesRoss: Just one uh, one additional relationship thought. Probably something your already familiar with, uh, women talk! (smacks Chandler over the head with a magazine)ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Metaphorical TunnelScenesWritten by: Alexa JungeScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's: everyone is there and they are watching an info-mercial that stars Joey.]
rows.Content: Host: Welcome everybody, welcome to Amazing Discoveries!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, oh! It's on again!ScenesJoey: You guys, can we please not watch this all right.ScenesAll: Shhhh!ScenesHost: Folks, has this ever happened to you. You go to the refrigerator to get a nice glass of milk, (Joey is in the background struggling to open a cartoon of milk) and these darn cartons are so flingin'-flangin' hard to open.ScenesJoey: (on tv) Oh, you said it Mike. (rips open the carton and spills milk on the counter) Aw! There's got to be a better way!ScenesMike: And there is Kevin.ScenesJoey: Can we please turn this off?ScenesRachel: Noo way, Kevin.ScenesMike: There is a revolutionary new product that guarantees that you'll never have to open up milk cartons again. Meet the Milk Master 2000.ScenesRoss: (to Chandler) Are you intrigued?ScenesChandler: You're flingin'-flangin' right I am!ScenesMike: Keep in mind, he's never used this product before, you're gonna see how easy this is to do. (to Kevin) Go ahead. ('Kevin' starts using the product, it is a spout that you jab into a paper milk carton so that you don't have to rip it open.) This works with any milk carton.ScenesJoey: (on TV, finishing installing the Milk Master 2000) Wow, it is easy. (starts to poor the milk) Now, I can have milk everyday.Scenes(They all start laughing at him)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, Janice are sitting on the couch, and Phoebe is sitting next to them in the chair.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Well, it's official there are no good movies.ScenesJanice: Well, let's go to a bad one and make out. (they start to kiss and lean back into Monica.)ScenesMonica: Perhaps, you would like me to turn like this, (turns sideways on the couch) so that you can bunny bump against my back.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey.ScenesChandler: Hey, man. What's up?ScenesJoey: Maybe you can tell me. My agent would like to know why I didn't show up at the audition I didn't know I had today. The first good thing she gets me in weeks. How could you not give me the message?!ScenesChandler: Well, I'll tell ya I do enjoy guilt, but, ah, it wasn't me.ScenesPhoebe: Yes, it was! It was him! Uh huh! (they all stare at her) Okay, it was me!ScenesJoey: How is it you?ScenesPhoebe: Well, it was just, it was all so crazy, you know. I mean, Chandler was in the closet, counting to 10, and he was up to 7 and I hadn't found a place to hide yet. I-I-I meant to tell you, and I wrote it all down on my hand. See, all of it. (shows him her hand)ScenesJoey: Yep, that's my audition.ScenesMonica: See, now this is why I keep notepads everywhere.ScenesPhoebe: Yep, and that's why we don't invite you to play.ScenesJanice: What is the great tragedy here? You go get yourself another appointment.ScenesJoey: Well, Estelle tried, you know. The casting director told her that I missed my chance.ScenesPhoebe: That is unfair. I'll call her and tell her it was totally my fault.ScenesJoey: Pheebs, you can't do that. The casting director doesn't talk to friends, she only talks to agents.ScenesPhoebe: What a sad little life she must lead. Okay, ooh (starts dialing).ScenesJoey: What, what are you doing? What are you doing?ScenesPhoebe: No, no, no, I know, I know, ooh. (on the phone in a different voice) 'Hi, this is Katelynn, from Phoebe Buffay's office. Um, is um, Ann there for Phoebe, she'll know what it's about.'ScenesJoey: Hang up, hang up. (reaches with his good arm, but Phoebe grabs it and he tries to reach the phone with his other arm but can't because of the sling.)ScenesPhoebe: (on phone) 'Annie! Hi. Listen we got a problem with Joey Tribbiani, apparently he missed his audition. Who did you speak to in my office? Estelle, no, I don't know what I'm going to do with her. No. All right, so your husband leaves and burns down the apartment, the world does not stop.'ScenesChandler: Is anybody else scared?ScenesPhoebe: (on phone) 'Right, well look, um, if Joey loses this audition, that is it for Estelle. I don't care! Annie you are a doll, what time can you see him?' (to Monica) I need a pen. (Chandler hands her one, but she needs something to right on, so she tilts Chandler's head over and writes on the back of his neck)ScenesChandler: Get the woman a pad! Get the woman a pad! A pad! A pad!ScenesMonica: Oh, now you want a pad.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Carol and Susan are dropping off Ben]
rows.Content: Carol and Susan: (entering) Hey!!ScenesRoss: There's my boy! Here's my boy! And here's his Barbi (Ben is holding a Barbi doll) What's ah, what's my boy doing with a Barbi?ScenesCarol: He picked it out of the toy store himself, he loves it.ScenesSusan: He carries it everywhere, it's like a security blanket, but with ski boots and a kicky beret.ScenesRoss: Yeah, it's, it's, it's cute. Why, why, why does he have it, again?ScenesSusan: So he's got a doll? So what? Unless you're afraid he's gonna grow up and be in show business.ScenesCarol: This doesn't have anything to do with the fact that he is being raised by two women, does it?ScenesRoss: You know what it's fine. If you're okay with the Barbi thing, so am I.Scenes(cut to later in the day)ScenesRoss: Give daddy the Barbi! Ben, give, give me the Barbi. Okay, how 'bout, don't you want to play with the monster truck? (makes a monster truck sound) No. Okay, oh, oh, how about a Dino-soilder? (squawks like a dinosaur)ScenesRachel: Ross, you are so pathetic. Why can't your son just play with his doll? (uses the Milk Master 2000 to pour milk into her cereal)ScenesMonica: (entering from her bedroom) I gotta go to work. Has anybody seen my left boob?ScenesJoey: I love that movie. (Joey is using it as a pillow)ScenesMonica: There it is. Joey, what are you doing?ScenesJoey: I'm sorry, it just felt nice.ScenesChandler: (entering with his ringing phone) Joe. Joe! Answer the phone.ScenesJoey: Hey, I only got one good arm, you know. You should be doing stuff for me. Go get me a sweater.ScenesChandler: Just do it! Okay, it's Janice and if I get it I'm going to have to see her tonight. (phone stops ringing) Oh, that's great I'm gonna have to see her tonight.ScenesRachel: What's the big deal? Why don't you wanna see Janice?ScenesChandler: Okay, last night at dinner, when the meals came, she put half her chicken piccata on my plate and took my tomatoes.ScenesRoss: And that's bad because..., you hate chicken piccata?ScenesChandler: Noo.ScenesRoss: You didn't want to share your tomatoes, tomatoes are very important to you.ScenesChandler: No, it's like all of the sudden, we were this couple. And this alarm started going off in my head: 'Run for your life! Get out of the building!'ScenesRachel: Men are unbelievable.ScenesMonica: What is it with you people! I mean, the minute you start to feel something, you have to run away?ScenesChandler: I know, that, (looks at her fake chest, and loses his train of thought, temporarily) that's why I don't want to go tonight, I'm afraid I'm going to say something stupid.ScenesMonica: Oh, you mean like that guy thing where you act mean and distant until you get us to break up with you.ScenesJoey: Hey, you know about that?!ScenesChandler: Look what do I do? I wanna get past this, I don't wanna be afraid of the commitment thing. I wanna go through the tunnel, to the other side!Scenes(Joey looks quizzically at Ross)ScenesRoss: (to Joey) Where there is no fear of commitment.ScenesChandler: Do we have any...(turns around and bumps Monica's fake chest) Do we have any thoughts here?ScenesJoey: Well, I've never been through the tunnel myself, 'cause as I understand it, you're not allowed to go through with more than one girl in the car, right. But, it seems to me it's pretty much like anything else, you know, face your fear. It have a fear of heights, you go to the top of the building! If you're afraid of bugs.....get a bug. Right. In this case, you have a fear of commitment, so I say you go in there and be the most committed guy there ever was.ScenesRachel: Amazingly, that makes sense.ScenesChandler: You think?ScenesJoey: Oh, yeah. Go for it man, jump off the high dive, stare down the barrel of the gun, pee into the wind!ScenesChandler: Yeah, Joe, I assure you if I'm staring down the barrel of a gun, I'm pretty much peeing every which way.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe's beeper is going off]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh, it's your audition from this morning. Can I use the phone again?ScenesRachel: Sure Pheebs, you know, that's what it's there for, emergencies and pretend agents.ScenesJoey: Come on baby, come on!ScenesPhoebe: (on phone, in 'Katelynn's' voice) 'Hi, I have Phoebe Buffay returning a page. Okay, well, um, she's in her car I'll have to patch you through.'ScenesRachel: Very nice touch.ScenesPhoebe: (in voice, on phone) 'Okay, go ahead.' (in normal voice on phone) Um, hi Annie. (listens) Fantastic! (to Joey) You got it. (on phone) Oh, okay, um, 'Will he work for scale?' you ask me. Well, I don't know about that, (Joey clears his throat to signify yes) except that I do and he will. Great, oh you are such a sweetheart. I would love to have lunch with you, how about we have lunch next....(hangs up phone) Op, went through a tunnel.ScenesRachel: Unbelievable.ScenesJoey: Thank you so much.ScenesPhoebe: It was really fun, I mean I've never talked on a car phone before.ScenesJoey: You were amazing, could you just do me this huge favor, you see there's this one other audition that I really, really want, and Estelle couldn't get me in.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I don't know. I mean it was fun one time.ScenesJoey: Come on, please, it'll be just this one more, well actually it's two.ScenesPhoebe: Two?ScenesJoey: Yeah! Well, well really it's three. Please. You're so good at it. I love you.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I'll do it, but just these three, rightScenesJoey: Nooo, four.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler and Janice are having dinner]
rows.Content: Janice: So, how come you wanted to eat in tonight?ScenesChandler: 'Cause, I wanted to uh, give you this. (hands her a present)ScenesJanice: Ohhh, are you a puppy! (opens it) Contact paper! I never really know what to say when someone you're sleeping with gives you contact paper.ScenesChandler: Well, wait there's, there's more. See the contact paper is to go into your brand new drawer. (gives her a drawer) See, the drawer actually goes in my dresser.ScenesJanice: Oh, you didn't have to do this.ScenesChandler: Yes, I did. Yes, I did. Because, you're my girlfriend, and that's what girlfriends should, should get.ScenesJanice: Well, I gotta buy a vowel. Because, oh my Gawd! Who, would've thought that someday, Chandler Bing would buy me a drawer.ScenesChandler: Well, not me. But that's what's happened, and, ah, and, and there's more. We should take a trip.ScenesJanice: We should?ScenesChandler: Yep, we're a couple and that's what couples do. And, I wanna meet your parents. We should take a trip with your parents!ScenesJanice: (laughs) I don't think we need to, because you're tripping me out right now! Are you okay?ScenesChandler: I am, I actually am. I mean this is amazing. My entire life I have feared this place, and now that I'm here it's like what was the big deal. I could probably say 'Let's move in together.' and I'd be okay.ScenesJanice: You probably want us to move in together?ScenesChandler: It doesn't scare me!ScenesJanice: Yeah, well, it scares me! I mean I not even divorced yet, Chandler. You know, you just invited me over here for pasta, and all of the sudden you're talking about moving in together. And, and I wasn't even that hungry. You know what, it's getting a little late, and I-I should just, um...(starts to leave)ScenesChandler: Oh, no, no, no, don't go! I've scared ya'! I've said too much! I'm hopeless, and awkward, and desperate for love!! (Janice leaves, Chandler then calls Janice to leave a message on her machine) Hey, Janice! It's me. Um, yeah, I-I-I just wanna apologize in advance for having chased you down the street. (runs out the door)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are comforting Chandler]
rows.Content: Rachel: Honey, this will help. (hands him a tub of ice cream)ScenesChandler: So, I finally catch up to her and she says this relationship is going to fast and we have to slow down.ScenesRachel and Monica: Uff.ScenesMonica: That is never good.ScenesChandler: Then I got all needy and clingy.ScenesRachel: Okay, wait a minute, wait a minute, wait a minute. Maybe it's not so bad. How did you leave it?ScenesChandler: She said she'd call me.ScenesRachel and Monica: Ohh! (both grab there stomachs in pain)ScenesChandler: Oh God.ScenesMonica: Welcome to our side of the tunnel.ScenesChandler: This ice cream tastes like crap by the way.ScenesRachel: Yeah, well that's that lo-cal, non dairy, soy milk junk. We sort of, we save the real stuff for those really terminal cases.ScenesMonica: You know, when you start get screwed over all the time, you gotta switch to low-fat.ScenesRachel: Yeah, you do.ScenesChandler: So, you don't think I'm terminal?ScenesMonica: Well, no, not at all, you're not terminal, you just, you just need some damage control.ScenesChandler: Okay, okay. So, should I call her?ScenesRachel and Monica: Nooo!ScenesRachel: This is a very critical time right now. If you feel yourself reaching for that phone, then you go shoe shopping, you get your butt in a bubble bath. You want her back you have to start acting aloof.ScenesMonica: She has to know that your not ready.ScenesRachel: Right. So, what you have to do is, you have to accidentally run into her on purpose. And then act aloof.ScenesChandler: So I'm not, not gonna lose her?ScenesRachel: Oooh, honey, you're not a total loser.ScenesChandler: I said, 'So I'm not gonna lose her?'ScenesRachel: Oh.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is still trying to get Ben to play with something other than the Barbi doll.]
rows.Content: Ross: Guess who's here. It's the toughest guy in toy land, Ben. (singing) 'A real American hero. I'm G.I. Joe!' Drop the Barbi, drop the Barbi.ScenesRachel: G.I. Joe? Do you really think he's gonna fall for that?ScenesJoey: (entering) G. I. Joe! Cool! Can I play?ScenesRoss: Look Ben, it's a toy that protects U.S. oil interests overseas!ScenesJoey and Ross: Go Joe!!!ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Helloo! Oh! (sees Joey and starts to leave)ScenesJoey: Pheebs! There you are!ScenesPhoebe: No it's not, sorry.ScenesJoey: But Phoebe, wait! Wait! Phoebe. Phoebe! (catches her in the hallway)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, Joey! Oh, okay, see I didn't recognize you wearing, in those....pants.ScenesJoey: Look listen, that TV movie I went in for? Did you hear anything? I think I got a shot at it.ScenesPhoebe: Yes! They called and you didn't get it! Okay, I mean you didn't get it, I'm sorry, I'm sorry.ScenesJoey: It's okay, these things happen.ScenesPhoebe: But they shouldn't happen, you know what, you're, you're in a terrible, terrible business. Oh God, I don't wanna be the person who makes your face look like that.ScenesJoey: I'm, I'm okay. See. (tries to smile, but fails horribly)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, now you're sad and creepy, oh. You know what, I, I'm sorry I quit, okay, I just quit.ScenesJoey: No! No, no you can't quit! You're the best agent I ever had! Look Pheebs, rejection is part being an actor, you can't take it personally.ScenesPhoebe: Not personal, really, well they said that they never met an Italian actor with a worse Italian accent.ScenesJoey: They actually said that?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. Ooh God, there's that face again! See I can't do this job! I...ScenesJoey: No, no, no, see that's why you have to do this job, agents always lie. You know, Estelle just says stuff like 'They went another way', but this, I can use this. (in a very bad Italian accent) I canna work on a new accent.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah okay, no if it helps you okay. Yeah.ScenesRoss: (running into the hall, in slow motion) You'll never get me, Joe!!! (he then pretends that he gets shot repeatedly and falls back against Joey and Chandler's door, dead.)

rows.Scenes: A grocery store that Janice shops in. Chandler is on purpose, accidentally bumping into her.]
rows.Content: Janice: (to butcher) No, thank you. (Chandler makes a sound and she notices him) Chandler!ScenesChandler: (in a British accent) Hello, Janice.ScenesJanice: What are you doing here?ScenesChandler: (in accent) Oh, just a bit of shopping. How've you been?ScenesJanice: Are you being British?!ScenesChandler: (normal voice) No. Not anymore.ScenesJanice: Why are you shopping here? You don't live in this neighborhood. Were you here waiting for me?ScenesChandler: Yeah, huh. I'm just uh, you know I'm just picking up some things for a party. (grabs a bag off of the shelf)ScenesJanice: Barley? What kind of party serves barley?ScenesChandler: Well, I'm sorry if my friends aren't as sophisticated as yours.ScenesJanice: Where is this party?ScenesChandler: Here in Chelsea.ScenesJanice: Who's party is it?ScenesChandler: A woman'sScenesJanice: What woman?!ScenesChandler: (shyly) Chelsea.ScenesJanice: Okay, you know, one of two things is happening here. Either you're seeing somebody behind my back, which would make you the biggest jerk on the planet. Or, else you're pretending that you're seeing somebody, which just makes you so pathetic that I could start crying right here in the cereal aisle. So like which of these two guys do you want to be? (another guy walks by)ScenesChandler: Can I be that guy?

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey and Phoebe are there]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Okay, so we got some more good rejections, lots of stuff to work on.ScenesJoey: Okay, shoot.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, um, oh, the zoo commercial.ScenesJoey: I didn't get it?ScenesPhoebe: No. They said you 'Weren't believable as a human being.' So, you can work on that.ScenesJoey: Okay, what else?ScenesPhoebe: Um, the off-Broadway play people said 'You were pretty but dumb.'ScenesJoey: Oh.ScenesPhoebe: Oh no wait, I'm sorry, that's 'pretty dumb.'ScenesJoey: Look, it's okay, no, no, no, really, look um, I really appreciate this Pheebs, but I think I'm gonna have to go back to Estelle.ScenesPhoebe: Oh.ScenesJoey: Yeah, well don't get me wrong, you're a better agent than she is, but at least with her I don't want to blow my pretty dumb brains out.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, no, I understand.ScenesJoey: You do, thanks.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. Sorry. (she starts to leave)ScenesJoey: Wait a minute.ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesJoey: Wait a minute, did you just make up all that stuff just to get out of being my agent.ScenesPhoebe: (in a coy tone) Oh, you caught me. I am so busted.ScenesJoey: (in a really, really bad Italian accent) That's-ah what I suspected-ah.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is laying on the counter and Rachel and Monica are comforting him again.]
rows.Content: Chandler: ....And then I just, you know, threw the bag of barley at her, and ran out of the store.ScenesMonica: My God! Chandler, we said be 'aloof' not 'a doof'.ScenesChandler: I've actually ruined this haven't I? It's time for the good ice cream now, right?ScenesRachel: Yeah, it is.ScenesMonica: You know what, everything's gonna be okay.Scenes(phone rings)ScenesChandler: (answering phone) Hello. Hi, Janice! Can you hold on for a second? Okay. (to Monica and Rachel) Okay, what do I do?ScenesRachel: Shhh...I don't know what to do, this is totally unprecedented.ScenesMonica: If-if-if we ever did what you did a man would never call.ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesChandler: Hello!ScenesMonica: Oh wait, you know what, I got it, I got it, pretend like you just woke up, okay, that will throw her off. Be sleepy.ScenesRachel: Yes, and grumpy.ScenesChandler: What are you, stop naming dwarves! (on phone) Hello, Janice. Hi, I'm so glad that you called, I know I've been acting a really weird lately. And, it's just because I'm crazy about you, and I just got...stupid, and, and scared, and....stupid a couple of more times. I'm sorry. (listens) Really?! (listens) Really?!ScenesRachel: He's soo lucky, if Janice were a guy, she'd be sleeping with somebody else by now.ScenesChandler: (on phone) I love you too.ScenesMonica: Aw, it's soo unfair. (they both start digging into the 'good' ice cream)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Carol and Susan are picking up Ben, while Monica is pouring chocolate syrup, lots of it, into her ice cream.]
rows.Content: Carol: G. I. Joe. G. I. Joe?!ScenesRoss: Hey, I don't know what to tell you guys that's the doll he chose.ScenesSusan: What'd you do, dip it in sugar?ScenesRoss: Look, G. I. Joe's in, Barbi's out. And if you guys can't deal with it, that's your 'too bad.'ScenesMonica: What are you being such a weenie for? So he has a Barbi, big deal. You used to dress up like a woman.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesMonica: Well, you used to dress up in Mom's clothes all the time.ScenesRoss: What are you talking about?ScenesMonica: The big hat, the pearls, the little pick handbag.ScenesRoss: Okay, you are totally making this up.ScenesMonica: How can you not remember? You made us call you...Bea.ScenesRoss: (remembering) Oh God.ScenesSusan: I've literally never been this happy.ScenesMonica: Wasn't there a little song?ScenesCarol: Oh please God, let there be a song.ScenesRoss: There was no song. (to Monica) There was no song!ScenesMonica: (singing) 'I am Bea.'ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesMonica: 'I drink tea.'ScenesRoss: Okay, that's, that's enough. (retreats to the bathroom)ScenesMonica: '....Won't you, won't you, won't you.... 'ScenesRoss: (coming out of the bathroom) Won't you dance around with me.ScenesMonica: A-ha!!! (they all start laughing, as Ross hides in the bathroom)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: It's an old home movie of the Geller's backyard, young Ross is dressed up as Bea, and pouring himself/herself some tea.]
rows.Content: Young Ross: (singing) 'I am Bea. I drink tea. Won't you dance around with....' (spills some tea and it drips onto his/her dress) Ohhh! (runs away crying)ScenesYoung Monica: (entering the shot) Ross!!! (starts to wipe up the spill)ScenesEndScenesThe One With Frank Jr.ScenesWritten by: Scott Silveri & Shana Goldnerg-Meehan.ScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joeys, there is lumber all over the apartment]
rows.Content: Chandler: (entering) Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey-hey-hey. So what happened? A forest tick you off?ScenesJoey: No. Y'know how were always saying we need a place for the mail.ScenesChandler: Yeah!ScenesJoey: Well, I started building one. But then I decided to take it to the next step.ScenesChandler: Youre building a post office?ScenesJoey: No, an entertainment unit, with a mail cubby built right in. Its a one day job, max.ScenesChandler: Okay. (notices that Joey is wearing some really tight jeans) My word! Those are snug.ScenesJoey: Oh yeah. These are my old work pants, Sergio Valentes.Scenes(Chandler goes to his bedroom and opens the door. However, only the top half opens, and he trips into his bedroom over the bottom half.)ScenesJoey: Power saw kinda got away from me there.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Outside Central Perk, Phoebe is pacing back and forth waiting for someone.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (joining Phoebe outside) Hey Pheebs.ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesRachel: Any sign of your brother?ScenesPhoebe: No, but hes always late.ScenesRachel: I thought you only met him once?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I did. I think it sounds y'know big sistery, y'know, Franks always late.ScenesRachel: Well relax, hell be here.ScenesPhoebe: No, I know, Im just nervous. Y'know its just y'know Moms dead, dont talk to my sister, Grandmas been sleeping a lot lately. Its like the last desperate chance to have a family, y'know, kinda thing. Youre so sweet to wait with me.ScenesRachel: Well, actually Gunther sent me. Youre not allowed to have cups out here, its a thing. (takes her cup and goes back inside)

rows.Scenes: inside Central Perk]
rows.Content: Chandler: Does anyone else think David Copperfield is cute?ScenesMonica: No, but he told me, he thinks your a fox.ScenesChandler: All right, Janice, likes him. In fact she likes him so much she put him on her freebie list.ScenesJoey: Her what?ScenesChandler: Well, we have a deal, where we each get to pick five celebrities that we can sleep with, and the other one cant get mad.ScenesRoss: Ah, the heart of every healthy relationship. Honesty, respect, and sex with celebrities.ScenesMonica: So, Chandler, whos on your list?ScenesChandler: Ah, Kim Basinger, Cindy Crawford, Halle Berry, Yasmine Bleeth, and ah, Jessica Rabbit.ScenesRachel: Now, you do realize that shes a cartoon, and way out of your league?ScenesChandler: I know, I know, I just always wondered if I could get her eyes to pop out of her head.ScenesJoey: Hey, Monica, who would yours be?ScenesMonica: First, I need a boyfriend, then I can have a list.ScenesJoey: Its just a game Mon. (makes a Can-you-believe-her face to the rest of the gang.) Rach, how about you?ScenesRachel: Oh, I dont know, I guess, Chris ODonnel, John F. Kennedy, Jr., Daniel Day Lewis, Sting, and Parker Stevenson.ScenesRoss: Spiderman?ScenesRachel: Hardy Boy.ScenesChandler: Peter Parker.ScenesRoss: Thank you.ScenesRachel: What about you honey, who would be on your list?ScenesRoss: Well I-I-I, that kind of thing requires some serious thought. First, Ill divide my perspective canidates into catergories....ScenesChandler: (coughing) What a geek!ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Everbody this is Frank! This is my half-brother Frank.ScenesAll: Oh, hi.ScenesPhoebe: This is everybody. This is Ross.ScenesFrank: How are you?ScenesRoss: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Chandler.ScenesChandler: Hi.ScenesFrank: Hi.ScenesPhoebe: Joey.ScenesJoey: Hey-hey!ScenesFrank: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: This is Monica.ScenesFrank: Whoa!ScenesPhoebe: And this is Rachel.ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesFrank: Whoa!!ScenesPhoebe: Im gonna get coffee.ScenesFrank: Hey, how do you guys get anything done?ScenesChandler: We dont, really.ScenesRachel: Well, so, now, do you guys have a lot of big plans?ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah! Yeah, no, were gonna connect, y'know bond, and everything.ScenesFrank: Yeah, I was thinking that maybe we could go down to Time Square and pick up some ninja stars. And, oh, um, my friend Larry, he wants me to take a picture of a hooker.ScenesChandler: You know, we dont really take advantage of living in the city.ScenesJoey: I know.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joeys, Joey is drilling a hole in the wall and the drill comes out the other side really close to Chandlers head. Chandler then rushes out to talk to Joey.]
rows.Content: Joey: Oh, Im sorry. Did I get ya?ScenesChandler: No, you didnt get me!! Its an electric drill, you get me, you kill me!!ScenesJoey: Calm down, do you want this unit or not?ScenesChandler: I do NOT want this unit!!ScenesJoey: Well, you shouldve told me that before, Im not a mind reader. Hey, were out of beer. Im going to Monicas.ScenesChandler: Fine! (goes into his room and slams the door, then he slams the bottom half of the door.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachels, Joey is entering]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey! Where ya headin in those pants? 1982?ScenesJoey: Oh Monica, listen, I ah, I saw down at the hardware store, they got those designer tiles on sale. If you ever want to redo the bathroom floor.ScenesMonica: Why, whats wrong with my bathroom floor?ScenesJoey: Nothing. Its just old and dingy, thats all.ScenesMonica: I highly doubt that. (they both go to the bathroom)ScenesJoey: Oh yeah. If you ah, move your hamper, you see what color the tile used to be. (Monica gasps) Yeah.ScenesMonica: I cant live like this! What are we gonna do? What are we gonna do?ScenesJoey: Relax. Here hold this (hands her his beer). This old stuff just comes right off. (he bends down to try and lift some tile right in the middle of the floor, in his tight pants.)ScenesMonica: Thats a little more than I wanted to see.ScenesJoey: (manages to pry off only a small piece) Aw! Look at that, every inch of this stuff is glued down. Itd take forever to pry this up. You should ah, you should just leave it. (starts to walk away, but Monica grabs him)ScenesMonica: I cant leave it! You gouged a hole in my dingy floor.Scenes(Joey places the toliet brush and holder over the hole, which is in the middle of the floor.)ScenesJoey: Eh! There you go.ScenesMonica: You know thats nice, y'know we could put it back there after the surgeons remove it from your colon!

rows.Scenes: Phoebes, Frank and her, are sitting on the counh, watching TV]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (sits up) Oh, ew!ScenesFrank: What?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah I know what I wanted to ask you. Um, can you roll your tongue? Because I can, and my Mom couldnt, and I thought y'know, I figured that was something I got from our Dad.ScenesFrank: What, wait, you mean like this? (does it)ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, yeah. You can do it to. (tries to do it, but cant)ScenesFrank: Your not doing it.ScenesPhoebe: Oh right, yeah okay, my Mom could, and I cant. We dont have that....ScenesFrank: Whens your birthday?ScenesPhoebe: Feburary 16th.ScenesFrank: I know a guy whos the 18th.ScenesPhoebe: Wow, thats close. Whens yours?ScenesFrank: October 25th.ScenesPhoebe: Thats the same month as Halloween. So, um, what kinda things do you like to do at home?ScenesFrank: Melt stuff.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross is working on his list]
rows.Content: Ross: Okay, Ive got three of my five.ScenesRachel: Three of your five, what?ScenesRoss: Celebrities Im allowed to sleep with.ScenesRachel: Oh my God! You are giving this a lot of thought.ScenesRoss: Yeah, its hard okay, I only have two spots left.ScenesChandler: All right, so who do you got it narrowed down to?ScenesRoss: Okay, Elizabeth Hurely....ScenesChandler: Oooh-hoo, very attractive, forgiving.ScenesRoss: Susan Sarandon.ScenesChandler: Eh, y'know what, shes to political, she probably wouldnt let you do it, unless you donated four cans of food first.ScenesRoss: And!! Isabella Rosselini.ScenesChandler: Ooh-hoo. Very hot, very sexy. But ah, y'know shes too international, y'know shes never gonna be around.ScenesRachel: So?ScenesChandler: So, you gotta play the odds, pick somebody whos gonna be in the country like all the time.ScenesRachel: Yeah, cause thats why you wont get Isabella Rosselini, geography.

rows.Scenes: Phoebes, Frank is melting a plastic spoon.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Okay so, by melting, you meant melting.ScenesFrank: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: So is it like art?ScenesFrank: Yeah, you can melt art. Hey, can I use your phone?ScenesPhoebe: Um, yeah sure. Why you wanna call your Mom?ScenesFrank: No, I wanna melt it.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, well um, not right now. Y'know Im just gonna go to bed, I think the fumes are giving me a headache.ScenesFrank: (starts laughing) Yeah!ScenesPhoebe: Gnight, bro.ScenesFrank: Gnight.ScenesPhoebe: Here. (gives him a fire extinguisher) Y'know, just in case.ScenesFrank: Oh, excellent. (starts to melt the fire extinguishers hose.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachels, Phoebe is eating breakfast with Monica while Frank is playing with num-chucks on the balcony]
rows.Content: Monica: What kind of karate is that?ScenesPhoebe: No kind. He just makes it up.ScenesMonica: So hows it going with you guys?ScenesPhoebe: So far, it kinda blows. I dont know, I just thought y'know that hed feel more like a brother y'know, like you and Ross, just like close and connected and....ScenesMonica: Oh honey, were close now but you-you wouldnt believe the years of-of nugies, and wedgies, and flying wedgies, and atomic wedgies, and....(Phoebe shakes her head like she doesnt understand) Thats where the waistband actually goes over your head.ScenesPhoebe: Ah!!ScenesMonica: Oh, we used to drive each other crazy playing the shadow game.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, how do you play the shadow game?ScenesMonica: Oh, how do you play the shadow game?ScenesPhoebe: I just asked you.ScenesMonica: I just asked you.ScenesPhoebe: I dont have time for this.ScenesMonica: No, that is what the game is.ScenesPhoebe: Which you just gave up really quickly.ScenesChandler: (entering) Have you seen Joey?ScenesMonica: Whats the matter?ScenesChandler: Oh, just this! (turns around and has a paint lid stuck to the back of his pants.) Yknow what its my fault really, because the couch is usually where we keep the varnish.ScenesJoey: (yelling from bathroom) Hey, does somebody wanna hand me one of those tiles.ScenesChandler: Whats going on?ScenesMonica: Hes retiling my floor. (they both run to the bathroom)ScenesChandler: Yo!! Spackel boy! Get up!ScenesMonica: Ah-ah-ah, now you started this, you will finish it.ScenesChandler: He started mine first!ScenesPhoebe: Build the unit Cinderelly, lay the tile Cinderelly.

rows.Scenes: Phoebes, Phoebe and Frank are watching TV.]
rows.Content: Frank: Whoa! Big octopus.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. (phone rings and Phoebe answers it) Hello. (listens) Oh my God, I totally forgot! (listens) Well cant someone else do it. (listens) But, I have company. (listens) Yeah, no look, thats all right Ill come in. (hangs up phone) Um, Frank, Im really sorry but I have to go to work. Its-its one of my regulars and hes insisting that I do um.ScenesFrank: Hey, what kind of work do you do?ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Im a masseuse. I give people massages and stuff.ScenesFrank: You-you work at one of those massage parlors?ScenesPhoebe: Well, y'know we dont call it that, but yeah!ScenesFrank: (starts laughing) Wow! Thats wild! No, I had no idea.ScenesPhoebe: All righty. Ill be back in-in a little bit. Unless you wanna come with me?ScenesFrank: You mean like watch?ScenesPhoebe: No, no, you can get one yourself. Itll be on the house! Y'know what are big sisters for?ScenesFrank: Well, I dont think this, y'know.ScenesPhoebe: No, no, no, I wouldnt do you myself, I mean that would be weird. Yeah, no, Ill get one of the other girls to do it. Oh, this will be so much fun! Hey! Are you excited?ScenesFrank: Yeah! Hey, do Monica and Rachel work there?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachels bathroom, Joey and Monica are admiring the new floor.]
rows.Content: Monica: Its beautiful! Its like the first bathroom floor there ever was. (Chandler tries to go to the bathroom) Whoa! Are you going in there for?ScenesChandler: What, like a number?ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hi! Bye! (runs to the bathroom)ScenesRoss: Okay, Im done with my choices, these are final. (holds up a little card)ScenesRachel: Well, its about time.ScenesJoey: Ooh, very official.ScenesRoss: Oh, yeah, well y'know Chandler printed it up on his computer.ScenesMonica: And who laminated it?ScenesRoss: That would be me.ScenesRachel: All right let me see. (grabs the card) Uma Thurman, Winona Ryder, Elizabeth Hurely, Michelle Pfieffer, and Dorothy Hammel?ScenesRoss: Hey, its my list.ScenesRachel: Okay honey, you do realize she only spins like that on ice.

rows.Scenes: Healing Hands Inc. (Phoebes work), Frank is being ushered in, by the arm, to the room Phoebe is in by another girl.]
